1411.content:
Your name was Leon Shen; you were a handsome man of 19 with tan skin, shot raven hair, and deep cerulean eyes. You'd been recently approved as the host family for a centaur girl, Cerea. You hadn't even met her or even seen a picture, but based on what the coordinator officer told you, she was fierce and loyal. Your parents were long since deployed overseas, but you had to take care of your five-year-old sister, Sherry.

Sherry heavily resembled you in appearance with some femininity, but she had amethyst eyes; the same kind that your mother has. She typically wore a blue undershirt and baggy orange shorts. Sherry had always been a bit of a tomboy; she didn't even let her hair grow out and kept it short like yours. Still, she was a very sweet girl and was always eager to find you a girlfriend.

Soon, the day came when the coordinator officer showed up with Cerea, which threw you both for a loop. While you knew that it would be a centaur, you didn't expect her to be drop-dead gorgeous. She had white skin, long blond hair in a ponytail, blue eyes, horse ears, and the biggest pair of breasts you'd ever seen before.

"Greeting masters. I am Cerea." Cerea greeted.

You only stared at her, like an idiot before you composed yourself. "Leon Shen. Pleased to meet you."

"I'm Sherry Shen! Your boobies are huge!" Sherry said, astounded.

What now?
1411.title: Normal.

1412.content:
Thirsty for some new powers, hmm? Well then, I won't keep it waiting, ladies and gents! And the first set of powers on our list is none other than Bionic Physiology.

More commonly known better as Cybernetic Enhancement/Cybernetic Implants, Bionic Physiology is the power to take on various physical characteristics of a robot, machine, weapon or android. The user either is or can transform into a machine. This include small factories instead of organs, manifesting instruments such as mechanical arms, weapons, etc. Some may be limited to specific mechanisms or parts to which the person's body can operate, other abilities may be limited only by one's imagination.

As for what this power's applications are, these abilities include:

*Enhanced Condition
--Enhanced Agility
--Enhanced Durability
--Enhanced Endurance
--Enhanced Strength
*Concussion Beams
*Gadget Usage
*High-Tech Exoskeleton
*Electronic Eyes
*Pain Suppression
*Scanner Vision
*Self-Sustenance
*Scientific Weaponry
*Roboticization
*Etc.

Though when it comes to limitations, Bionic Physiology is known to have some noticeable vulnerabilities, including some of the following:

*Those with Technology Manipulation powers can tender the user helpless. However, some users have this ability as a preventive measure, unless the attacker has the ability themselves.
*Run a risk of attacks from those who can emit Electromagnetic Pulses.
*May be limited on how long they can be in this form.
*May be limited on which part of their body can become robotic.
*May run the risk or are prone to a computer virus.
*Androids may be limited to fulfill its programming.

Throughout the media, there are many known users of Bionic Physiology, including those of the following names:
*Lady Deathstrike (Marvel Comics)
*Victor Stone/Cyborg (DC Comics)

141211.content:
"You can't run from your past. You'll end up running in circles. Until you fall back down into the same hole you were trying to escape from, only the hole's grown deeper."
-Max Payne 2

Your name is Dalton Xavier; A 21 year old Caucasian man from the United States, with some Canadian ancestry in your blood. In appearance, you had a mix of brown and blonde hair (known as "Dirty Blonde"), and jade green eyes.....or at least, you once had a pair of green eyes. To elaborate, you didn't exactly had a fully happy childhood, for you were kidnapped during a family trip to Africa when you were 9 years old by a group of guerilla fighters led by a deadly warlord.

With no other choice, you were molded into a child soldier, killing military soldiers in the African jungles. Eventually, you were rescued after 8 long years have passed. By then, you had built up a reputation among both the warlord's soldiers and his enemies, known only as "Aar libaax oo cad", which was Somalian for "The white lion", due to your proficiency of dual-wielding a large serrated knife in each hand, delivering lethal strikes up-close with almost inhuman speed, just like the notorious feline of the African Savannah.

Although your family was fortunate and relieved to see that you were still able to remember who they were, that moment of happiness didn't last very long when the Orcs violently slaughtered most of your family, despite you killing a few of these creatures with steak knives out of self-defense and lusting for vengeance. And this was before the Cultural Exchange Between Species Act was ever established.

However, you didn't come out of the tragedy....intact. Eventually, in retaliation for you killing some of their brethren, the Orcs broke the lower half of your legs, your right arm, and ripped out your right eye. This left you crippled for life.

-------------------------------------------
Present Day
Location: Tokyo, Japan
Time: 1:57 AM
-------------------------------------------

You woke up with a cold sweat, heart pumping at an almost panicked rate before calming yourself down. Unable to return to sleep, you sat up in your bed, hearing the muffled mechanical sounds of your Cybernetic Enhancements. Although it did give you back the body parts that were painfully stripped from you by those damn Orcs, you could still feel the invisible pain from the limbs you lost, as you stood up and slowly walked toward the large pane of glass that led out toward the balcony. Nowadays, in place of your original body parts, your cybernetic enhancements had this intimidating look to their appearance. The legs and right arm looked as if they were based off of General Grievous from Star Wars, while your right eye looked straight out of Deus Ex: Human Revolution.

Apparently, your childhood friends, Cody Hollard, Mitch Stanic, Garrett Hendrickson, and the oldest of the bunch, Steve McCain, offered to have you stay with them in their spacious penthouse within Tokyo's Shinjuku Ward. After all, they heard what happened to your family and decided to give you a home. Standing up, you looked out toward the skyscrapers that lit up the night sky, as you began to ponder about what had occurred only yesterday.

From what you remembered, Cody and the tear of your friends managed to land you a job within the government-led police task force known as "The Cultural Exchange Security Squad". However, they also introduced you to your new *ahem* commanding officer, the woman known only as "Ms. Smith".
141211.title: Bionic Physiology OC Option #1 (Reserved)

choices: Continue to present day, before the flashback.
Fast forward to tomorrow, when Ms. Smith arrives with the extra-species.
1412112.content:
-------------------------------
Yesterday
Location: McCain Penthouse,
Tokyo, Japan
Time: 2:35 PM
-------------------------------

"So, you must be Mr. Dalton Xavier. Mr. McCain and his associates have informed me about you." A woman said to you, drinking what appears to be a cup of coffee. In appearance, she had silky jet black black hair that reached below her hips in the back, but extended to just above her collarbone at the front, along with a pair of brown eyes. Currently, she wore the attire of the typical government agent, sporting a white dress shirt with a black tie, a black blazer and matching professional business skirt, black pantyhose and heels. And to complete the government agent motif, the woman wore a pair of black sunglasses, which were framed at a slightly lower angle to allow one to look her in the eyes, all while she sat on a moving chair, crossing her right leg on top of her left. This woman was none other than Ms. Smith, Representative of the Cultural Exchange Security Squad, and the Liaison/Commander of M.O.N, Monster Ops: Neutralization.

From where she sat, Ms. Smith was currently facing you, as you sat on the L-Shaped couch, hunched slightly forward, arms propped on your thighs in a balancing position, looking back toward the female government agent with a serious but subtly angry look on your face, still feeling this invisible pain from the cybernetic enhancements Steve and his corporation, McCain Cybernetics & Robotics, have installed on you.

After about a moment of silence between the two of you, Ms. Smith broke the silence as she spoke toward you after taking another sip of her coffee and answered, "I am deeply regretful about what happened to your family all those years ago, Mr. Xavier. My condolences." "......I'm used to it. So.....what exactly did my friends told you, lady?" You asked coldly, as you slowly moved your head upward slightly to look at Ms. Smith, still sporting a serious look on your face. After all, you lost your family to a bunch of monstrous Orcs, along with being crippled by them in the process, so recovering from such a traumatic experience would take time to heal on it's own.

However, you couldn't help but having a hunch that this Ms. Smith isn't just some pretty woman masquerading as an agent of the Japanese government, just as she set the cup of coffee gently onto the coffee table, then sat back into her original seating position, looking at you with a calm but no nonsense look in her eyes and said, "A lot. Or to be more precise, more than enough intelligence to take interest in you, Dalton. My....superiors wanted more information on you for our dossier. And besides.....I am aware of your occupation as a child soldier, Aar libaax oo cad."

Hearing that infamous name the Somalians call you made you go from calm to violent in a heartbeat, lunging toward Ms. Smith, knocking the chair backwards in the process, causing your friends to jump back out of shock, as you held Ms. Smith in a vice-like grip with your right cybernetic arm, baring your sharpened teeth made from being filed by the warlord himself, making this inhuman snarling growl toward Ms. Smith, still remaining calm under the tense situation while you stared her down and violently growled, "How. Much. Do You Know? ANSWER ME!!!"

"All of it, Mr. Xavier. From when you were first kidnapped by the guerrilla fighters when you were only 9 years of age, to when you've been brought into their ranks, all the way up to you carving a bloodied path of carnage through Somalia, Djibouti, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Kenya, Uganda, and South Sudan. I must admit, you are a rather dangerous beast, having the militia forces in the Horn of Africa trembling with fear." Ms. Smith answered, almost sounding if was impressed by your handiwork in Africa underneath that calm demeanor of hers, just you suddenly snapped at her and roared, "I never asked to become a goddamn bloodthirsty killer, bitch! Besides, how would you like it if you were taken as a kid by men who works for an African warlord who wants blood diamonds and loves torturing those who trespass on his turf in the most fucked up ways you can imagine!?!"

"Take it easy, Dalton! She didn't mean to get you ticked off like that!" Cody said, trying his best to reason with you, despite your current mood at the moment, doing his to prevent you from bringing harm to Ms. Smith. From there, Steve sided with Cody on this matter and replied, "With all due respect, Ms. Smith, you're not exactly helping with easing tensions between you and Dalton here. After all, he's basically been through Hell for a long time, and he's still recovering from the trauma involving the death of his family."

At first, your friends that you were seeing reason, but when they saw you raising your cybernetic right arm to deliver a Concrete-busting punch, Cody, Mitch, Steve, and Garrett yelled at you in unison and said, "Dalton NO!!!!"

It all happened so fast, as your four friends heard a very loud crunching noise, thinking you might've killed Ms. Smith out of anger. But instead, they saw that she was still alive and mostly in one piece, with the only thing that suffered the attack was the very chair Ms. Smith sat in, with your closed cybernetic hand just centimeters away from actually hitting Ms. Smith's head. From there, you slowly pulled your cybernetic arm out from the chair you damaged, flexing your mechanical fingers and thumb a little to see if there was any internal damage done.

Then, shortly after you got up and walked toward the kitchen to grab a bottle of Sprite to drink, Steve went toward Ms. Smith and help her back onto her feet as he spoke toward her and apologized, "Ms. Smith, I am so sorry for Dalton's behavior toward you. He isn't usually this violent." "Although he spilled my coffee in his little violent outburst, I will make an exception for Mr. Xavier's violent antagonistic behavior. That is.....if he is able to fulfill a certain condition, of course." Ms. Smith replied, as she dusted herself off a little, obviously unaffected by your enraged outburst.

"And what sort of condition do you have in mind?"Mitch asked, raising an eyebrow in confusion, as you listened in on the conversation while drinking Sprite. "Well, as Cultural Exchange Coordinator, I assign members of each extra-species to a Host Family, along with providing information and advice, supervising and support homestays and host families, you name it. All I am requesting is for Mr. Xavier here and his.....friends, to be the host family for a certain representative candidate for our Interspecies Homestay Program. Do this, and I will ensure Mr. Xavier will be hired as a member of the Cultural Exchange Security Squad. After all, it will help to improve his resentful attitude toward the other extra-species." Ms. Smith answered, presenting the offer in full view, already aware of the potential of having a squad member with cybernetic enhancements.

"I don't hate every extra-species, lady! Just those damn Orcs!" You snarled, lashing out at Ms. Smith for the misinterpretation of your resentment. From there, you vented out some of your anger when you violently slammed the door to your bedroom behind you, threatening to mercilessly rip the door hinges from the wall. Despite you leaving the room, Steve and your friends accepted Ms. Smith's arranged deal, while you sat there in your bedroom, venting out your inner rage somewhat in an effort to calm down.
1412112.title: Meeting Ms. Smith

choices: Fast forward to morning, waiting for Ms. Smith & Cerea to arrive.
Fast forward to tomorrow morning, heading to your new job.
14121121.content:
-----------------------------------
Present Day
Location: McCain Penthouse,
Tokyo, Japan
Time: 2:44 AM
-----------------------------------

Although it was still only a mere few hours until sunrise, you were unable to return to sleep, either it was from the loud noises emanating from the handiwork of the construction crew readjusting the penthouse to make living arrangements more suitable for the extra-species candidate for the homestay, or from the psychological trauma that now inhabits your nightmares. Either way, you were definitely not going to be getting a good night's rest.

"*sigh* Sounds like I won't be getting any more sleep tonight." You said to yourself, obviously disgruntled by getting a lack of sleep from the construction work outside your room. Knowing that you weren't going to be sleeping soundly for the rest of the night, you went over to the lamp sitting on the nightstand, flicking the switch to shed some light through the darkness.

But what caught you a little off-guard was the stack to reading material laying on the drawer nearby, causing you to raise your right eyebrow in both confusion and curiosity. Carefully, you slowly approached the stack of reading material, hearing the tapping sound of the curved talons on your cybernetic feet each time they made physical contact with the floor. After treading across the room, you reached the reading material, revealing to be a file of sorts and a large hardcover book underneath the file. However, you then noticed that there was a note placed on top of the file, as you peeled the note off to get a better look, reading it as it said:

Dalton,
While you were still sleeping, Ms. Smith gave us the documents related to the extra-species candidate who will be living here with us. Lucky for you, she's not an Orc. Me and the guys all signed our signatures, all you have to do is sign next to the X, and we'll turn the file in to Ms. Smith when she and the extra-species representative arrives here tomorrow. Also, we managed to buy you a book that has a lot of information on her race. You know, just in case you don't know how to care for her.

-Mitch
P.S: If you hear some loud noises outside your door, that would be the construction crew readjusting our home for the homestay.

"*sigh* Too late for that, Mitch." You thought to yourself shaking your head from left to right in a slightly disappointed manner, crushing the note into a ball of crumpled paper and tossing it into the trash bin. Fortunately, since you were calmed down from your violent outburst earlier, you're able to be reasoned with, as you stood there looking at the file and book stacked on the drawer. At first, you wanted to just ignore what the note said and just watch some TV in your room.

But then again, looking at it now, you approached the stack, thinking to yourself and thought, ".....Well, I guess.....it wouldn't hurt to find out who exactly is staying with us." From there, you grabbed both the book and the file, carrying the reading materials with you toward the bed. Although you did turn on the TV, you changed channel until you hit Japan's Weather Channel, as you opened up the file to read through the information before you.

"Name: Centaurea Shianus...... Monster Species: Centaur, Gender: Female...... Well, at least she isn't an Orc." You thought, as both your left green eye and your cybernetic right eye thoroughly scanned through the intel printed onto the file's pages. Of course, you were already familiar with what a centaur actually was; a living being with the upper body of a human, but the lower body of a horse. After all, you've seen a small handful of centaurs while you were taking a stroll through the streets of Shinjuku a few days ago, only they were female centaurs.

"Hair color: Golden blonde......Eye color: Blue.... Furcoat color: light chestnut..... I'm guessing they're talking about the color of the fur on her horse half." You thought for a moment, just as you continued reading through the file's dossier, as you then read her measurements and thought, "Breasts: 103.....Hooooly Shit, she's gotta be an I-Cup with melons at that size!" Knocking yourself out of your testosterone-filled stupor, you punched yourself with your cybernetic right arm, despite bruising your jaw some, where you then spoke to yourself and growled, "Goddammit, Dalton! This isn't the time to act like a damn pervert!"

Shortly after recovering from inflicting some self-harm onto yourself, you returned to reading through the dossier's info, reading to yourself and thought, "Waist: 61..... Hips: N/A(Immeasurable)........ Hmph, guessing that Smith's lackeys couldn't measure a centaur's hip size due to this girl's horse half." Unfortunately, you were unable to get any information on Centaurea's weight and height, since the height info had 3 question marks instead of actual numbers, while the weight info only said "Secret". However, you pardoned the lack of info on her weight, since that's sort of inappropriate to find out from a woman, human or not. Though as for the height, you could guess that she's most likely taller than the average human male.

Aside from the information about Centaurea's physiological attributes, you also found out that Centaurea Shianus' biological family happened to be one of the bravest and strongest family lines amongst the centaur race. "So, this Centaurea Shianus happens to be the latest in a long line of centaur badasses...... *chuckle* Well now, maybe having her here might not be a bad idea after all." You thought to yourself, unable to stop yourself from crack a smirk of intrigue, a little....impressed by Cerea's family lineage.

While you inevitably signed the contract, you began to read through the book Mitch and the others had placed along with the file. Turns out it was a book about centaurs, from their culture, to the subspecies within their race, right down to their laws, basically everything about them.
14121121.title: Know Thy Extra-Species

choices: Your friends explained the situation to Ms. Smith.
Actually, you explained it to Ms. Smith.
Surprisingly, Cerea explained the situation to Ms. Smith.
141211211.content:
-------------------------------------
Present Day
Location: McCain Penthouse,
Tokyo, Japan
Time: Sunday, 11:34 AM
-------------------------------------

Although you managed to read through the entire book about the centaur race in it's entirety, morning had already arrived. You were currently sitting on the couch alongside Garrett and Mitch, while Steve and Cody were using a laptop on an island table in the kitchen, negotiating with the corporation's next project in cybernetics. After all, you were sort of a willing test subject to the cybernetic enhancements that you were now augmented with.

Though while Mitch and Garrett were playing in an online cooperative mode against other players in Grand Theft Auto Online via the giant Flatscreen TV, you sat there in the same position from yesterday, looking directly at your cybernetic right arm, slowly flexing your mechanical digits in a forward and backward motion, expanding and contracting, all while patiently waiting for Ms. Smith to come through those doors with the centauride known as "Centaurea Shianus".

After all, even though you were given a good fistful of info about the female centaur, the dossier didn't include a photo of what she looks like in appearance. Your guess is that Ms. Smith wanted to make it a surprise. Since it was currently in the 60s today, you were wearing an olive-drab green T-shirt with a pair of modified stonewashed jeans due to the cybernetic enhancements on the lower half of your legs.

Fortunately for you, you didn't have to wait long, as the 5 of you distinctively heard the sound of a doorbell ringing, prompting Garrett and Mitch to forcefully resign from the online match, while Cody momentarily put a hold on the company's project. "Sounds like our guests have arrived, boys."Garrett said, just as he and Mitch were approaching the altered double doors, then proceeded to look through the door's peephole to make confirmation if it was Ms. Smith or not.

When Garrett confirmed that it was them, you stood up from the couch, while Steve and Cody moved away from the island table and made themselves visible for the centauride that would inevitably pass through those doors. Then, both Garrett and Mitch opened each side of the double doors simultaneously, allowing both Ms. Smith and Centaurea to enter the McCain Penthouse.

From there, you and your friends heard what sounded like the clopping noise of a horse's hooves tapping against the tiled floor, as Ms. Smith and Centaurea walked through the front door, giving you a good long look at what the female centaur's physical appearance. Turns out the dossier was right on the money about her physical attributes; sky blue eyes and golden blonde hair, which was very long in length and tied up into a high-ponytail. Her skin was a fair Caucasian hue, as her white/pale beige buttoned-up sleeveless shirt showed her exposed arms on display.

Like the hair on her head, Centaurea's horse tail was a golden blonde as well, poking out from a tailhole in her black skirt, while the ebony skirt was large enough to extend halfway down the equine legs of her horse half, allowing her hooves and horse legs to be physically visible. She had what appeared to be a red handkerchief wrapped around her neck like a business suit tie, all while noticing that instead of having human ears, she had what appeared to be horse ears instead, as they were visible enough to see that those weren't fake ears. Finally, what caught your interest the most was what she had in her possession: A large, two-handed sword known as a Claymore, a notoriously lethal great-sword used in Scotland. You remember seeing this medieval weapon on Deadliest Warrior, witnessing how it was capable of multiple decapitations in one swing with ease.

According to the book you read from earlier, female centaurs, while known for their beauty, were just as strong as their male counterparts, favoring technique and refined skills instead of focusing on strength like male centaurs would. This meant that Centaurea could easily wield a Claymore with one hand instead of both hands. Overall, you were become a bit more intrigued by the female centaur, crossing your arms and showing a small smirk on your face and thought, "Well now, things just got a bit more interesting. I always wanted to see a Claymore up close."

Currently, you noticed that the Claymore that Centaurea was carrying with was sheathed for the time being. "Greetings, masters. Thy name is Centaurea Shianus. 'Tis an honor to meet all of you." She said, greeting you and your friends in a chivalrous manner, speaking in a somewhat archaic manner. "Well, it's nice to meet you too, Centaurea. I'm Mitch, that's Garrett, Cody, Steve, and the guy over there with the robot arm and legs is Dalton." Mitch replied, greeting the blonde centauride and introducing himself, the others, and you.

From there, just as the bellhop brought in what appears to be a case for a second sword, Centaurea calmly approached you, showing both her experience as a warrior at such a young age, along with showing her maturity almost like a badge of honor, despite her physical age. It wasn't until she stopped just 4 and a half feet away from where you currently stood, forcing you to look up to make eye contact with her and vice-versa, as she then spoke to you and said, "So, thou must be the one called Dalton Xavier. Ms. Smith explained to thee about your....troubled past. Thy deepest condolences for what thou have endured."

"I guess. Although I do appreciate your sympathy Centaurea, the stuff I've done in Africa isn't something to write home about." You replied, losing the smirk on your face , still having your arms crossed. However, Centaurea quickly spoke to you and answered, "Tis alright, thou can call me Cerea if you want." Normally, you were calm but somewhat distant due to the traumatic experiences you have gone through. However, there was something.....comforting about Cerea, almost familiar. Either that, or your hormones were making you focus on her hefty I-Cup boobs, despite your right eye being cybernetic instead of organic.

For about an hour or two, Cerea sat there as she watched you play Bloodborne on the PlayStation 4. After all, while Mitch and Garrett preferred games like Grand Theft Auto that allows one to screw with the game's denizens, you preferred to play a video game that has an overwhelming difficulty but rewards you for the effort in defeating enemies without getting killed yourself such as Dark Souls and Dark Souls 2.

But as you were fighting against one of the game's bosses, The Blood-Starved Beast, you moved your character on-screen to quickly dodging it's charging attacks, where you staggered the grotesque creature with your character's firearm, then performed a Visceral Attack on it's head, inflicting a good chunk of damage on it. However, while you were fighting against the Blood-Starved Beast on-screen, Steve and the others handed the signed contract over to Ms. Smith, sealing the deal with Cerea's stay here. "The Cultural Exchange Program appreciates your cooperation, Mr. McCain." Ms. Smith answered, storing the signed document in a briefcase.

From there, she turned to face you as you were halfway through the battle against the Blood-Starved Beast, despite that she was behind you currently, and said, "Oh! And before I forget, Mr. Xavier. We managed to induct you as a member of the Cultural Exchange Security Squad. However, I dislike being the bearer of bad news, but you will have to patiently wait for a month until we fully legitimately have you join the squad."

"What?!" You exclaimed, quickly turned around to face Ms. Smith, long enough for the Blood-Starved Beast to land that fatal blow toward your character on-screen, killing him as those infamous words appeared on-screen saying "YOU DIED", which was a notorious staple to the work of Hidetaka Miyazaki, the creator of the Souls franchise and Bloodborne. Quickly turning back around to face the screen, you saw what happened, causing you to instinctively yell, "NO!!!"

Judging from how you were reacting, Cerea could most likely tell that what just happened on-screen wasn't a good thing to you. Why, even Ms. Smith was caught off-guard a little by your yell of frustration. From the perspective of your friends could already tell what was going to happen, as they spoke in unison and said, "Uh oh." "What do you mean 'uh oh'? It's just a game." Ms. Smith, obviously underestimating the problem she unintentionally had created.
141211211.title: Introduced To A Well-Endowed Centaur

choices: Skip to when you're in the gym, venting your rage on a training dummy.
Skip to when you return form the gym, just in time for dinner.
1412112111.content:
In an attempt to explain the situation to Ms. Smith, Mitch spoke first and said, "You see, that game Dalton was playing, Bloodborne, it's......very difficult." "And with good reason. When your character gets killed by whatever you're fighting against, you lose all of the game's currency in the process, known as Blood Echoes." Garrett explained, speaking after Mitch had spoke toward Ms. Smith.

"And judging from the way that Dalton is reacting, I'm guessing that he had a whole lot of Blood Echoes on him." Cody answered, crossing his arms out of confirmation. "Smith: You've got 5 seconds to leave, so start. Running. NOW." You growled, becoming just the slightest bit more hostile toward the Cultural Exchange Coordinator, showing just how pissed off you really were.

Obviously noticing how tense you were currently, Ms. Smith saw that trying to tempt that short fuse of yours spelled out trouble. So left with no other choice, she complied with your threat, and left the penthouse, briefcase in hand. Shortly after the double doors closed behind her, you managed to calm yourself down, inhaling and exhaling several deep breaths to make the transition easier.

After all, you were only aiming your frustration toward Ms. Smith, not Cerea, as you exhaled a sigh before speaking and said, "I'll be in the Gym if anybody needs me. Venting some anger issues of mine." From there, you walked around Cerea, as you made your way toward the double doors, closing them behind you, while you proceeded down the hallway towards the elevators. Besides, ever since your family members were murdered by a group of Orcs, your anger issues had become slightly more unstable, but not enough to make you a complete psychopath.
1412112111.title: Never Anger A Bloodborne Player.

choices: Skip to an hour or two, as you & the others eat dinner.
Actually, let's bring in the racists!
14121121111.content:
-------------------------------------------
Present Day
Location: Sakura Sakimasu Hotel Gym,
Tokyo, Japan
Time: 2:31 PM
-------------------------------------------

Meanwhile on the 6th floor, you were currently within the hotel's gymnasium, pushing yourself to the very limit, taking your anger out on multiple training dummies, using a hybrid mix between Thailand's Muay Thai and Somalia's own form of stickfighting known as Istunka. Normally, you would use a set of 14 inch serrated blades when fighting. But since you weren't exactly allowed to bring your blades down to the gym, you were left with no other choice but to use 14 inch metal rods, acting as substitutes for your weapons of choice.

However, due to your Cybernetic Enhancements, you're able to use your mechanical talon-like feet as a second set of hands, grabbing a training dummy with inhuman speed with your talon-like feet while doing a backflip, tossing the training mannequins around like ragdolls. Although there might have been a few onlookers inside the gym who were impressed by your fighting prowess, a small handful of veteran martial could see the rage in your fighting style, displaying how brutal you possibly were when you're enraged, delivering attacks that would be very painful if the training dummies were actually living people.

But while you were moving from mannequin to mannequin, delivering blow after blow upon the lifeless entities, you didn't notice that the Claymore-wielding centauride herself, Cerea, had entered the hotel gym, escorted by Steve along the way. After all, according to the laws of the Cultural Exchange Program Act, homestays are not allowed to roam outside the residence without being accompanied by a member of their assigned host family and their documented proof of homestay, unless said homestay carries an approved special exception permit.

In laymen terms, Cerea wasn't allowed to leave the penthouse without either you, Cody, Mitch, Garrett, and/or Steve to accompany her. "Well, there he is. Sorry you had to see Dalton lash out like he did a few hours ago, Cerea. He's been like this somewhat since his family were murdered by the Orcs." Steve said to Cerea, being polite toward the female centaur, as he rubbed the back of his head a little from what happened earlier.

In response, Cerea turned herself around a little to directly face Steve and reassuringly replied, "Tis no problem, master. Thy understand that master Dalton yields a dangerous flame within." "Look, I fully understand that your race's culture is important to you. But with all due respect, Cerea; just call me 'Steve-O'. The other guys do. After all, since you are a part of our family." Steve answered, informing Cerea not to call him 'Master', along with showing he meant no disrespect toward centaur culture.

"Oh, I almost forgot! Here, give this to Dalton. He needs to know that he needs this to prevent confusion with law enforcement." Steve said, handing what appears to be an ID card as proof for being a host family member to Cerea, who took the ID card from Steve's hand and nodded in response. From there, Steve waved goodbye to the centauride, as he proceeded to leave the hotel gym and head back up to the penthouse, which left you with Cerea.

Hearing the all-too-familiar sounds of a warrior honing his combat skills, Cerea approached you with a calmness in her stance, like she was very familiar with seeing and experiencing combat. However, you didn't become fully aware of the blonde centaur's presence until you heard the sounds of her hooves making contact with the floor with each step, making these loud clopping sounds against the floor's white tiles.

Now with the realization that you had a visitor, you stood back upright on your cybernetic legs, turned right and took notice of Cerea standing only several feet away from where you're currently standing. From there, you spoke toward the centauride and said, "Don't tell me: You came down here to find me?" "Yes. Master Steve accompanied thee to find you, Master Dalton. Besides, thou were verily impressive when I was watching you home your skills." Cerea answered, as she approached and sat down beside you, obviously taking a bit of interest in you as well.

"Thanks.... It's a result from my forced captivity in Africa when I was a kid. Nothing new to me." You replied, almost unfazed from the traumatic experience of becoming a child soldier while you talked to Cerea about it a little. You weren't completely sure why you're not going berserk yourself toward Cerea like you did with Ms. Smith. You thought that maybe it was because she seemed not so pushy, you don't know for sure.
14121121111.title: Mixed Martial Arts & Cybernetics

choices: But then, you heard your cell phone go off.
Before you could continue, some racist started trash-talking Cerea.
141211211111.content:
As you took notice of Cerea's sitting location, you took a bottle of Sprite from the nearby vending machine, carrying it to a vacant gym bench, sitting down and drank the cold tasty beverage. From there, you walked toward a nearby bench, sat yourself down to consume some of your drink. "Forced.....captivity?"She asked, turning her head to face you, cocking an eyebrow out of confusion, almost as if this was sudden news to her.

It wasn't until you realize why she said such a thing, as you quickly turned your head to face Cerea, having this slightly shocked look on your face and said, "Wait a minute, Smith....never really.....told you about what happened to me.....did she?" Cerea could do nothing but slowly shake her head from left to right in confirmation. In theory, your guess was that Ms. Smith didn't give Cerea a good enough explanation to your backstory, figuring that you might give the centauride the details.

So, after letting out a frustrated sigh from Smith's laziness to explain things a bit, you then spoke toward Cerea and answered, "Alright, Cerea......I'll give you the details. BUT! I warned you; it's not exactly.....pretty to hear. In other words, listen at your own risk." "I understand." Cerea replied, displaying how courageous she was when facing the truth, displaying her bravery like a badge of honor and bravery, you could even swear she had this fearless look in her eyes as well.

Seeing that she was obviously undeterred by your advanced warning, you moved both your left green eye and your cybernetic right eye, directly looking at Cerea. At first, you were a little hesitant yourself due to the traumatic experiences from being a child soldier in the Horn of Africa, since what you've experienced had taken a slight toll on you psychologically. So, after taking another short but rejuvenating drink from the bottle of Sprite in your left hand, you let out a long sigh before speaking toward the centauride and said, "Normally, I don't usually....confess about what happened to me all those years ago. But.....I'll make you as an exception, Cerea. *sigh* I....I was taken away from my family during a trip to Africa. I was only at the age of 9 when I was taken. The soldiers who took me from my family.....they were known as 'Ciidamada ugaarsadaha'. It's Somali for 'The army of Hunters'.....and they called themselves by that name for a good reason."

"Somali?" Cerea asked, still listening to what you were telling her, looking as if this was new to her. Becoming aware of the slight confusion from Cerea, you continued to speak toward the female centaur and explained, "It's basically the main language of the country with the same name, Somalia. It's located at the very tip of the Horn of Africa. From what I remember, Somalia's capital city is known only as 'Mogadishu'. For the rest of my childhood and most of my teenage years......I've only known war, growing up throughout the decades-long conflict known to history as the Somali Civil War. Growing up around this constant cycle of violence can take a toll on you, where every day felt like a fight for survival. There would've been a good chance I might have lost all forms of my sanity if I didn't come to bear with the truth: Even humans can become our own monsters."

Despite her royal chivalrous bloodline, Cerea could see that you spared almost no detail with explaining your time in war-torn Africa, almost shocking her that you were forced to experience such nightmarish horrors, including being caught in the middle of the dreaded Somali Civil War, having no choice but to either grow up and survive or become a casualty of the war. However, as you continued to explain your story with such a grim and somber tone in your voice, Cerea couldn't help but feel somewhat.....sympathetic toward your plight, especially since had to learn how to kill a man at such a young age.

Normally, when it came to being immersed into the life of another warrior, Cerea would show respect for said warrior's combat prowess and martial skills. But no, that wasn't the case for you. After all, your rise as a deadly warrior was much darker and tragic than what a race of violent militaristic demihumans who've lived around the art of combat could even stomach in a normal combat situation. All the more reason for Cerea to feel genuinely sorry for what you were forced to endure, causing her centaur ears to bend at a slightly lower angle, showing her sympathy toward you on display as she said, "I am sorry, I.... I was not aware of your....tragic upbringing."
141211211111.title: Having A Nice Conversation.

choices: From there, you asked to see if everybody was alright.
Then, you and Cerea decided to head back upstairs.
1412112111113.content:
But then, before you were able to say anything back toward Cerea, you heard the sound of an all too familiar yet mercilessly annoying male voice come out of nowhere as it said, "Hey! Who the hell let this freak in here?!" Hearing what was heard, you and Cerea turned around to see who it was. In appearance, the man looked to be in his mid to late 20s, sported black semi-spiky hair, had pale brown eyes, and bearing a scrawny physique. He was wearing gray cargo pants, boots, white sleeveless shirt and jacket belonging to one of Tokyo's notorious anti-extraspecies gangs, The Humanists.

"Tetsuo Fujiwara, lieutenant of The Humanists. What does that freaking asshole want this time?" You thought, looking at Tetsuo with an ire-filled glare, as you set your Sprite down on a nearby table, stood upright, with obvious intent on giving Tetsuo a piece of your mind. However, just as you were circling around Cerea to approach the Humanist member, Tetsuo threw an empty beer bottle in the female centaur's direction, as the launched projectile missed Cerea by only a few centimeters, causing the empty glass bottle to shatter upon impact with the floor.

Seeing this displaying of antagonistic superiority reminded you of the first few hellish weeks of being kept at the warlord's militia camp, where the older child soldiers would throw broken bottles at you to either strengthen your ferocity or to break you. That alone made you more hostile toward the almost anorexic gang lieutenant, as you approached Tetsuo, both hands clenching into fists. "Stay out of this, tin man! This here's Humanist business!" He said, as he noticed you approaching him, calling you by that infamous name you've gained ever since you received your cybernetic enhancements: tin man.

But then, just as you were only a short few feet away from him, instinctively punched Tetsuo right in the face with your left hand, fracturing a of his teeth in the process. From there, shortly after he recovered from your left hook, Tetsuo wiped a bit of the blood leaking from his mouth, where he then proceeded his attempt to retaliate as he yelled, "Why, you little...!" Unfortunately for him, your reflexes were drastically sharper than his own, as you quickly used your cybernetic right arm to counter Tetsuo's fist, stopping it in it's tracks.

Then, you used your cybernetic arm and hand to squeeze tightly on the gang lieutenant's fist, causing Tetsuo to fall on his knees out of physical pain while he yelped, "OW! OW! OW!" Normally when a fight would break out in the hotel gym, someone would try to stop the conflict. However, from what Cerea had observed with her own jade green eyes, she could obviously see that nobody was attempting to stop you from grinding the bones in the man's fist into dust.

"If there's one thing I hate as much as those damn Orcs, it's people. Like. YOU." You snarled, showing your rage toward Tetsuo and the faction he belongs to, nostrils flaring, sharpened teeth exposed, causing you to squeeze a little tighter on Tetsuo's fist, threatening to fracture the lieutenant's bones in his hand. From there, you looked at him right in the eyes, continuing to speak and said, "People who they're the superior ones. People who think they're the apex of the human race. But you and the douchebags you call your friends have forgotten one important thing: Even humans can become their own monsters."

"So you better damn listen, Tetsuo! The female centaur in here with us, she's with me. And if EVER see you, your comrades, or both coming anywhere near her..." You growled, leaning your head forward to get right in Tetsuo's face, showing just how serious you were, intimidating the gang lieutenant in the process. From there, you continued what you were saying and snarled, "....I'll make you and your merry band of racists pay with your lives. UNDERSTOOD!?!"

All that he could do in response was rapidly nod yes out of fear and being intimidated by you, so you've looked at Tetsuo with a fearsome look in your eyes and answered, "Good. Now get out of my sight, and never come back here again. NOW!!!" Hearing you roar at such a volume was more than enough to send the frightened Tetsuo fleeing, as you let go of his hand, allowing him to run out the door and as far as his legs could carry him, desperate to get some space between you and him.
1412112111113.title: And Here Comes The Local Jackass

choices: Skip ahead to a few days later.
Skip ahead to a week or two later.
14121121111132.content:
After around a minute or two had passed since Tetsuo had bolted out of the hotel gym (and hopefully out of the building as well), you were able to calm down from that violent outburst of yours toward the cowardly Humanist lieutenant, inhaling and exhaling several deep breaths. From there, you suddenly heard the sound of horse hooves slowly clopping against the floor tiles, as you turned around somewhat to see a calm but reasonably concerned Cerea approach you, hands in front of her, touching her abdomen a little.

"Master, are you unharmed?" She asked, stopping only a few feet away from you, obviously aware of how hostile you were toward Tetsuo, along with checking to see if you were alright. In response, you tilted your head slightly upward to speak to her, rubbing the back of your head with your left human hand, scratching it a little, and answered, "*sigh*....I'm fine, Cerea. It....This isn't exactly what I would call a good day for me."

"Let's...*frustrated sigh* let's just head back upstairs. Besides, I think I've already unintentionally caused enough public disorder for one day." You said, turning around to walk out the gymnasium exit, allowing those who were participating in exercising to resume their daily/weekly workout uninterrupted. Cerea soon followed suit, walking behind you until she was slowly trotting beside you, as you both reached the 6th floor elevator lobby. Then, you pressed the Up button to have the elevator ascend to the upper floors. And after waiting for almost 20 minutes, you both saw the elevator doors open, where you entered the elevator, with the female centaur proceeding inside with you.

Shortly after the elevator doors when you pressed on the button that leads to the 24th floor, Cerea made an obvious attempt to pass the time, as she spoke toward you and asked, "So....who was he? It seems that you and this Tetsuo whoreson have a hateful rivalry towards one another." Hearing Cerea call Tetsuo a 'whoreson' obviously amused you, as you displayed a smirk, subtly chuckling in unison for a second or two, figuring that the word itself seemed very fitting for a man like Tetsuo and the group he's affiliated with.

However, having a feeling that Cerea wasn't exactly going to let this slide, you figured that you might as well give the centauride an explanation, so you crossed your arms and explained, "His name is Tetsuo Fujiwara. As for who he is, Cerea; that scumbag happens to be a lieutenant of the Humanists." "And what are these....Humanists?" Cerea asked, cocking an eyebrow a little toward you, obviously she hasn't heard of the Humanists before until now. Despite her lack of knowledge of the group, you continued to explain to the female centaur and answered, "....They're scum. A gang of extremists who believe in keeping their territories pure. Out of all the racism toward your kind and the other extra-species, these bastards are the ones who have done the most damage, putting more gasoline on that damn bonfire of theirs."

"*sigh* My apologies, Master. It seems that thy arrival has burdened you and your friends." Cerea apologized, her voice sounding somewhat somber in a sense, feeling like she unintentionally brought trouble along. However, from seeing the almost depressed look on her face, you couldn't help but feel....sympathetic toward this plight. In an effort to at least brighten her mood, you spoke toward Cerea and replied, ".....To tell you the truth, Cerea.....the Humanists don't just hate Centaurs and other extra-species, they....they also hate people who happen to be cybernetic....like me."

Hearing the words you said obviously knocked her out of her depressed stupor, coming to a realization, as she turned her head to face you and asked, "So...thou are accustomed to their hostility?" "In a way, yeah. The Humanists happen to be a gang of purists, which means they hate anyone who isn't human or fully human. Hmph, too bad for them they didn't know I was a cold-blooded killer. Otherwise, they would not have so many of their members injured." You answered, Cerea could tell that you obviously had come to terms with the realization that you were capable of killing people.

"Overall, we're basically in the same boat, Cerea." You replied, just as you both felt the elevator stop moving, where the doors opened to the 24th floor, where the McCain Penthouse was located on. Shortly after you both stepped out of the elevator, you turned right and slowly approached the double doors leading into the penthouse, where you looked at Cerea and said, "And Cerea...." "Yes?" She asked, turning her head to face you, curious about what you're going to say. From there, you answered, "...Don't call me Master."

14133111.content:
(Leon, Miia) (Note: Duel Monsters will also be used in this story)

Name: Leon Midnight di Selene Seiryu.

Age: 18.

Gender: Male.

Blood-type: A+.

Birth country: Japan.

Residing country: Japan.

You are part of the once mighty Seiryu clan. A clan that was founded in the beginnings of the Edo Era in 1603 an whose sole dedication was to protect the world, sometimes in sight and sometimes from the shadows, and has done so through out the centuries. However, 13 years ago, when you were on your fifth birthday, the clan's village was invaded by a very powerful demoness named Akuha Bloodriver, her generals, Naraku (Inuyasha), Makoto Shishio (Rurouni Kenshin), Sailor Galaxia (Sailor Moon), Boa Hancock (One Piece), Caesar Clown (One Piece), Akua Shuzen (Rosario+Vampire), Seta Sojiro (Rurouni Kenshin), Camula (Yu-Gi-Oh! GX), Sartorius (Yu-Gi-Oh! GX) and Paradox (Yu-Gi-Oh! Movie that features Yugi, Jaden and Yusei) and their army of demons and monsters. They killed almost everyone. With you being the only survivor. And you only survived, because Bloodriver thought it would be amusing to see you struggle to survive alone in the world. However, what they didn't know, was that you were never alone. For, ever since you were born, you were able to see and communicate with the spirits of the Duel Monsters. You had a bond with all creatures on the village's Zen Garden. But there was five creatures with whom you shared an even deeper bond, as they were there, besides your mother the day you were born. Those creatures were Blue-Eyes White Dragon, Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon, Stardust Dragon, Carbuncle Ruby and Dark Magician Girl. Also, while the village was destroyed, the underground vault of the village had somehow remained intact. Thus you were well off.

The Seiryu were a clan of powerful warriors and magicians. Many times they aided the Regents of Japan in battle and had supported them when needed. Some members of the Seiryu were known and recognized as some of the greatest warriors and magicians of all Japan. And it was considered an honor to be trained by one of them. So great was their reputation. However, the Seiryu didn't answered anyone. No. For them to fight for someone, that someone had to earn their respect. For the Seiryu took principles and honor very seriously. And so, in the times they were summoned, they answered to the Regents ONLY.

For instance, If someone like, say, a snobby noble, decided they wanted to command the Seiryu or drive them around, they would soon find out that they were biting more than they could chew. The Seiryu wouldn't harm them. No. Instead, they simply let the nobbles do whatever they wanted to and ignored them. After they tired, they would give all and every bribe or monetary gift the nobbles had tried to buy them with to the Regents. The Seiryu made a point to keep their motto. Which was, "Power is not for oneself. It's for the others. It is to be used to the good of everyone. Not for personal gains. It is to be used to protect the innocents. Not to judge and punish."

And so, they used their power and wealth to help and protect the less fortunate. Many books and poems were written in their honor, narrating their stories and their deeds. However, if one were to search for history records and other documents about them or tried to find their village, they would find nothing. That would be so because The Seiryu Clan had requested the regents that, if something were to happen to them, that every document about them should be erased. They asked this because evil doers or simply ambitious beings could try to use the contents and information in the documents to cause harm to the people. And the Seiryu would rather be forgotten than allow such tragedies to happen. And so, the Seiryu and the Regents had divided all the knowledge they had in books and other documents in half. Each side had kept one half and decided to place a special spell that was linked to every Seiryu that already existed and to every newborn. That is, so long as the regents knew of their existence.

The effect the spell would have, was that if the Seiryu ceased to exist, all and every document related to the Seiryu would automatically be destroyed. However, in the end, and unbeknownst to the regents, only half of the documents were destroyed. Because, while the regents spell wasn't linked to Leon, the clan's spell was. Thus, since there still was a Seiryu breathing, the documents in the clan's vaults and library remained unscathed. However, since the regents at that time didn't knew about that, they thought that the Seiryu clan no longer existed. It was indeed a very dark, tragic and sad day in the history of Japan when the land lost the Seiryu clan.

Leon's existence was kept a secret, even from the regents, not only because of the Duel Monsters bonded to him, but also because of the great power he possessed. A power so great, that in order for you to survive, they had to place 7 Seals on your body as a baby. The Seiryu believed that each and every person was guarded by a Constellation. However, unlike most people, Leon was born in an extremely rare alignment of the Pegasus, Dragon, Sagittarius, Aquarius, Pisces and Scorpion constellations during a Blue Moon. The alignment of 6 constellation happened only every five thousand years and always with different constellations. Due to you having so many guardian constellations, your armor was a mix of all six.
14133111.title: Character introduction.

141331111.content:
(Leon (you), Centorea (Cerea), Ms. Smith, Mr. Izumi, Konata Izumi)

The year is 2015. In 2012, the government revealed the existence of monsters, or Sub-Species, as they're called, to the world. At first, it was expected that people wouldn't agree with that. That there would be conflict and fighting. However, none of that happened.In fact, humans actually welcomed them, despite them ranging from several different species. The government held a meeting at the UNO's (United Nations Organization) headquarters and an agreement was reached. It was named I.E.B (Interspecies Exchange Bill). With it, humans were allowed to take it monster girls into their homes and serve as their host families. However, in order to avoid conflict and abuse from either side, several rules were implemented. Some where more enforced than others. But there were three that were always strongly enforced. And violating any of them would bring severe consequences. Those three most important rules were:

-"A monster cannot go outside without at least one member of their host family. Failure to comply may result in deportation".
-"Monsters cannot harm humans and humans cannot harm monsters. Failure to comply will result in deportation and will also result in prison of the offender". Which was good. Because, while most accepted and welcomed these new, mysterious beings, there were others that despised them for being different and wanted them gone.
and
-"Humans and members of the sub-species cannot commit consummate a sexual act unless they are married. Violation of this rule will result in prison to the offender(s) and deportation of the sub-species member(s)". This last one ensured that nor humans or sub-species abused sexually of each other.

You currently lived in a two stories house that counted with a single bedroom, a suite, a social bathroom, a small library, a living room, a kitchen, a larger than normal service area and a guest room. While you were well off, you preferred to keep your home a simple one. Today, a saturday, you woke up and did your morning routine, which consisted in bathing, brushing your teeth, dressing yourself and fixing breakfast. Since that day was sunny, you decided to drive around on your bike and run some errands while you're at it. You grabbed your keys and your helmet and went to the garage. Once there, you took your bike outside and made sure to lock your home. This was a peaceful neighborhood. But it was always better to prevent than to repent. You then got on your bike and drove of to the market to buy some groceries. On the way there, you stopped at a fruit and vegetables store that, while it was small and didn't have that much variety of products, you had come to learn that the owners, an adult man and his teenager daughter, always kept them fresh and clean. You got off your bike and entered the store.

"Oh! Ohayõ, Leon-kun! Came to do some shopping? Or... Maybe you have come for my little Konata? *wink*"

You blushed a little at that. Mr. Izumi was always trying to hook you and his daughter, Konata, together. In the 6 years that have passed since you've known them, you've learned that Mr. Izumi is perverted lolicon otaku. Konata was an otaku herself and tended to compare daily situations to things form Anime and games. You always were welcomed here. Especially because you had helped Mr. Izumi in raising Konata. Thus, Konata saw you as an older brother.

"Ohayõ, Mr. Izumi. And I've come to buy some fruits and vegetables.", you said with a smile.

"Well, my Konata has two fruits that are quite fresh, you know~?"

That made you blush again.

"*Ahem!* Oto-san. I think you're making Leon uncomfortable. By the way, ohayõ, Leon-nii."

"Ohayõ, Konata-san. And don't worry. I've long grown used to Oji-san's delusions and perverted thoughts and comments."

"Hey!"

"Be quiet, Oto-san. You know it's true!"

"Well, yeah! But no need to rub it in the face!"

"Anyway, what will it be today, Leon-nii?"

"Two lettuces, 5 tomatoes, 4 carrots, a pot of oregano, four apples, two tangerines, two kiwis and a tray of strawberries please."

"Okie dokie lokie!"

Konata went to pick things up quickly and, within 5 minutes, she had everything at the counter, ready for you to pay.

"Arigatõ, Kona-chan."

"No problem Leon-nii."

You paid and, once that was done, you came out of the store, after saying good bye, got on your bike and went to get some meat at the supermarket. After that, you went home. When you arrived, you parked your bike and got out of the garage. As you were nearing the door, you heard an uncommon sound. It sounded like, galloping. Then you heard a shout.

"Look out!"

You turned to see who had shouted, only to have your face covered in two soft mounds of flesh as you and the mysterious female rolled in the ground until you both hit a wall, with you ending on top of her.

"Owww.", she complained.

You tried to get up, only to accidentally place your hand on something soft, big and firm.

"Aah~"

You opened your eyes to see that you had grabbed one of her tits. She looked at you and, when she saw how you were grabbing her left breast...

"G-get off me!", she said, while getting up.

"S-sorry!", you said, whit your face as red as a strawberry. "Are you alright?"

"Y-yes, I believe so.", her face was quite red too. "Thank you. And I apologize for running into you like that."

"No need to worry. I just hope the things I bought survived."

The two of you went to your original starting point, and saw that most of the groceries were either, inedible or smashed.

"S-sorry.", she said with her head lowered in shame. She was utterly embarrassed! Her first encounter with a human and she already had blundered! "*How unfit of my kind!*"

She was sure she had angered this human and that he was going to report her to the police! Then she would be arrested or deported! And her honor would be forever tarnished! And she would never get to meet her master! She was surprised when she felt a gentle hand on her right shoulder. She opened her eyes and saw that the young man was giving her a warm smile and his crimson eyes were gentle.

"Don't worry about it. Accidents happen."

Had she heard right? This, admittedly handsome, young man had forgiven her so easily!

"A-arigatõ."

"No problem."

Then, for the first time, you took a good look at your new acquaintance. She was a beautiful and tall centauress. She had long shoulder length blonde hair tied in a ponytail. Her horse half had a beautiful light brown coat and a blonde tail and she had what had to be the biggest pair of breasts you had ever seen. She then noticed you were staring at her.

"W-what is it? D-does it frightens you that I'm a centauress?"

You shook you head. "No. Not at all. Rather, I think both, your human half and your equine half are beautiful."

That made her blush like a tomato.

"*He thinks I'm beautiful on both halves?!*" She was glad that, although her first human encounter was terrible, she was lucky that it was with a kind and understanding young man. She found herself wishing that this human, this young man, was her master.

Suddenly, a black van appeared seemingly out on no where! It stopped right in front of you. Out of it came several men with weapons ready to be fired and, after they had come out, a woman in a black business suit with brown stockings and black shades. She had long black hair that reached just below her shoulders.

"We finally found you, Centorea Shianus-san."

"Ms. Smith."

"Why did you run? We were going to-"

"I know. But, us, centaurs, prefer to find our masters on our own."

"I know. But the law says-"

"I know what the law says.", Centorea said, with a stern and annoyed tone.

"*sigh* And you."

"Hm?"

"Would you happen to be Leon Midnight?"

"Who would like to know?"

"Ah, right. I didn't introduced myself. I'm Ms. Smith. I'm the coordinator of the I.E.B. You were selected to be host family to a sub-species member."

"Oh? I see. Pleased to meet you Smith-san. Yes. I am Leon Midnight. Now, who is it that I will be hot family to?"

"Right. Uh... Who was it?", she asked to someone inside the van.

"A bit irresponsible and unreliable, isn't she?"

"*sigh* I've come to learn that the hard way."

"Alright. Here it is. Now let's see here... Well! Isn't this fortunate?"

"Huh?"

"Eh?"

"According to the information I have, Leon Midnight is to be the host family of Centorea "Cerea" Shianus. Seems like we ended in the right place after all! Is this alright with you both?"

"Sure. I have no problem with it."

"And you, Centorea-san?"

She smiled. Her wish had come true after all!

"I accept as well!"

After you signed some papers with Ms. Smith, you and your new friend Centorea, or Cerea, as she asked you to call her, entered your home.

(continued...)
141331111.title: The Start of Something New

1413311111.content:
You opened the door and invited Cerea to come in. She did so and, while your house was of a moderate size, the rooms, furniture and facilities were too small for her.

"L-Leon-kun?"

"Please, just Leon will do."

"O-okay Leon.", she said, a bit shy."Um, I do not wish to bother you but-"

"It's okay Cerea-san. I can see the issue. Don't worry. I'll have some workers do some reforms and make the house suitable for the both of us."

"I see. But, please don't add the "san" to my name, alright? If I am to call your name without honorifics, I would like it if you did the same."

You smiled warmly at her, which, although she didn't quite understood why, made her feel as if her heart skipped a beat.

"Fair enough. Anyway, since the workers are going to be working, I think I could go and get some groceries. Would you like to come with me?"

"Yes! If it's not too much trouble I would like to help reposing what I ruined. It's the least I could do!"

"Well, I already told you not to worry about it. All right then. Wait for me outside please. I'll make the call and I'll meet you outside in a few minutes."

"Very well."

"Quite formal aren't you?", you said with a raised eyebrow. "Is that a common trait among Centaurs?"

"Yes. We are taught to be formal since foalhood. And that is because we are a noble race from England that descends from the knights of old!", she declared with pride.

"Hmmm... Interesting. Once we get back, I would like to hear more about that."

Tough she simply smiled and nodded on the outside, Cerea squealed internally. Glad that her new friend, and possibly her master, was interested in her people's history.

"But, in echange, I would like to know about you more as well."

"Alright then. It's settled."

Cerea then went outside while you called for the workers. After a few moments, she heard the garage door open and saw you come out with your bike. When you looked at her, she was looking at your bike and was with her jaw on the ground.

"Do you like it?"

"W-what is that... thing?"

"This? It's called a motorcycle. Commonly called "Bike". I take it you never saw one before?"

Cerea shook her head. And, as she saw you mount the "Bike", she felt, strangely, angry and, slightly jealous. "*Why am I feeling this way? He's not my master. At least, not yet. And yet, seeing him mount that, that, metallic beast makes me feel as if I should be in it's place. As if he should be mounting me instead of that thing.*"

Unaware of Cerea's distress, you started your bike's engine, put your helmet on and gided your bike to line it up with Cerea.

"Ready to go?"

Cerea merely nodded with what seemed to be a forced smile.

"Are you alright Cerea?"

"Yes! Yes. Don't worry about me."

"Well, if your sure...okay. Let's go then."

However, before you could depart, a total of four black utilitarian vans showed up. From out of them, came several men in worker's clothes, as well as your coordinator.

"Hello again Leon-kun, Centorea-san."

"Hello Smith-san."

"What is the meaning of this?"

"Well, we knew your house wasn't fit for a centaur. And our Architecture and Construction branch intercepted your request for workers. So, these men and women are here to make sure the house is a comfortable place for the both of you! Now, any specifications you would like to make before they begin?"

Both you and Cerea sweatdroped. It seemed that Ms. Smith could be a responsible woman, when she wanted to be so.

"Well, not really. Just make it so it remains the same style. A mix of modern and traditional Japan. Although I do want for you to leave the house's outline as it is. Meaning that each room must remain where it already is. Also, please refrain from going into the basement and the training room. The basement because it has things meant for me and for those whom I choose to share them with. And the training room, because it is very dangerous and it's programmed to launch attacks at any stranger that enters it unauthorized."

"I see. But we're going to-", you interrupted.

"I know you intend to cut the house's power. But the training room has a separate energy source that is within it. So, please, for your own safety, do not go there."

"Very well. Alright people! Get to work!"

Immediately, the workers began breaking parts of your house and reforming others. Following your instructions and leaving the basement and the training room alone.

"Well then, shall we go?"

"Eh?"

"What do you mean "we" as in, including yourself?"

"You're going to buy groceries no?"

"How do you know that?!"

"Please. Don't underestimate our intelligence networks. Although I just assumed you were going to buy things because of the groceries I saw on the floor before."

Again, both, you and Cerea sweatdroped. Only this time, you also sighed.

"Also, there are somethings I wish to discuss with you, Leon-kun."

"Oh?"

"Besides", she said, as she got close enough to you that you were almost within kissing range. Much to Cerea's discomfort and chagrin."I want to make sure that not you nor Cerea-san do any...improper things, if you know what I mean. *wink*"

Both, you and Cerea's faces became tomato red.

"Just what are you thinking you twisted and perverted woman?!", said Cerea completely flushed and with her eyes looking like spirals.

"That's right! Even if Cerea and I were dating, which we are not, there's no way we would do that yet!"

Cerea's ears perked at that. She wasn't sure what to make of your statement.

"Oh? Is that so? Why? Don't you think she's beautiful?"

"Of course she's beautiful! And I mean all of her!"

That caused Cerea to blush further.

"Heh? Then why-"

"One, because I'm fully aware of the laws of the I.E.B! Which states that a human and a member of the sub-species can not commit sexual acts unless they are married. And two, I would never force myself on her! I would only do this kind of things with her if she was willing to do so!"

Both, Smith-san and Cerea smiled at you. Smith-san was glad that they had picked the right guy to be host family for Centorea. And Cerea was happy that you would think so much of her and that you cared so much for her.

"*I have decided! He's my master! I can't possibly have anyone else as my master!*"

Smith-san then straightened herself up.

"I'm glad to hear that. Anyway, shall we get going?"

You both nodded. Then, Smith-san got into one of the vans and the three of you departed to the market.

choices: Tio calls him back to the room
1551111.content:
This is a story of a young man whose name is Akira Sakka. He stands about an average height of 5' 6", have a slim build weighing in around 173lbs, and have nice decently cut short brown hair. His is around twenty years old and is now attending college for a degree involving cyber security and computer sciences. Most of his classes are online, which means he stay home a lot. He lives alone, and has lived alone for about the first year of the college semester. However, now everything had changed. Akira looked for some company, but not just normal company; he wanted his life to be a bit more interesting. When the Interspecies Exchange Bill was passed, he knew exactly that he had found it. After the Exchange Officer inspected the home, and with slight reconstruction, the young boy was waiting. Akira was slightly excited, constantly having to adjust his glasses to prevent them from falling off. He wondered what monster was coming. The only thing he knew was that she was originally working for Monster Ops: Neutralization, or M.O.N. for short. So that meant she had first hand training on how to handle some situations. He saw the car pull up, gently holding in his excitement. Once the door opened, however, the excitement turned to surprise. Out stepped this massive monster girl! She must had been over two feet higher than him! She had nicely tanned skin, long flowing hair, and a red horn growing out from the top of her skull. However, the horn was not the takeaway for the boy. Two massive breasts hung at the monster's girl's chest, and judging on how she walked, they were full of bounce. Just watching made Akira blush slightly. Now he knew why his doorframes were built higher. She approached him with a gentle smile and wave as she tugged her suitcase behind her, "Hi! My name is Tionishia! But my friends call me Tio!" She bowed, giving Akira a full landscape view of her massive mammaries. "Its nice to meet you!"

Akira blushed as he tried not to stare, "L-Likewise..." he rubbed his head in slight embarrassment. "So uh...can I...give you the tour?"

"Yes please!" She quickly grabbed the small human and pulled him into the home in one full motion. The car driver chuckled before she went back inside and pulled off. Akira's home was nothing too special. It was originally built with two floors and additional bedrooms since it was originally built for more than one. He got a good deal since he had a friend in the marketing of this neighborhood. The boy showed Tio the kitchen, living room, and such.

"And I believe this is your room" he spoke as he opened a large door on the ground floor. Tio walked in very excited, seeing everything her size was very nice. Akira had to marvel at the size of everything; it made him feel like he was a little kid. "So, once you're all settled in I can get dinner started."

"Oh wait!" She grabbed his hand and pulled him back, making him bump into her but not moving an inch. "You never told me your name" the oni asked as she lifted him to her face by his one hand.

Akira did his best to smile aside from the pain from her grip. "I-Its...Akira...Akira Sakka."

His face was suddenly consumed by her twin mountains in a tight hug. "Thank you so very much for letting me stay here! I promise I will be the best thing you ever asked for!" The boy's face became bright red, and stayed bright red even after the hug ended and he left her room. What did he sign up for? That remains to be seen.
1551111.title: Living with an Oni

15511111.content:
Meat was apparently the best preference for onis and oni-like monsters. Akira took this into thought as he prepared dinner. He too was a meat lover, and he always bought more for later, so cooking for two wasn't a problem at all. However, cooking for someone like Tio would be trouble. She was far larger than him, so he had no idea how much to really prepare. "Tio?" he asked, "How hungry are you?"

"Whatever you make is good!" he hears her shout. He shrugged and then attempted to guess. After about twenty minutes, the meal was prepared. Two bowls, one larger than the other, or delicious pork ramen was made with additional sides of various foods. "Tio, dinner's ready!" He sat down as his new friend came out. She smelled the air with a delighted smile, quickly taking her seat and began to eat. "I hope I made enough for you."

She spoke with her mouth full, unable to be properly heard. But he assumed she said something along the lines of "This is fine." Aside from the sounds of chewing, the meal went quietly. Tio finished her larger bowl before Akira even ate half of his. Eating some of the sides, the gentle giant smiled, "So Akira, tell me about yourself."

"Huh?" he looked up from his food. "Well...what do you want to know?"

"Um..." she thought it over cutely. "What are you doing? Any jobs?"

"Well I'm in college right now" he smiled back. "I'm working with computers."

"Oh!" she smiled, "So you're really smart." Akira blushed at that remark; even if it was kind of stereotyping. "But if you're in college, how do you pay for everything?"

"I also do repairs and help run some business's stocks. Its keeps a fair amount of money in my account." The ogre smiled to this. I cannot believe how cute she was. She was so patient too. "What about you?"

"I am a member of M.O.N. I...well I forget what it stands for." Again, she was too cute to be displeased at. "I am usually the escort or something like that."

"Because of how big you are?" That comment appeared to have set something off, because she gasped and huffed at Akira. Before the human could ask, she got up and walked back to her room; leaving the human confused. A door slam was heard to signify her annoyance. Akira sighed as he sat up and started to clean off the table. Obviously he said something wrong, the human tried to think of what he said, but could not think of what he exactly said to her. But he did know that he needed to apologize.

A little later he approached her door, gently knocking on it. The door opened and Tio peered out. "Yes?" she replied with a slight tinge of annoyance in her voice.

"Hey..." he told her, "I'm sorry for what I said." He lifted up something for her, "And I got you t-" The door was whisked open with such a strong force Akira was almost sent forward. He had a decent sized piece of chocolate cake, leftover from a party he attended a while ago. Tio grabbed the plate and ate the piece in one large bite. Chocolate smeared all over her face and some landed on her cleavage uncovered by her clothing. "So..." Akira spoke, "Is that apology accepted? Or is it a-" He was taken into another hug, being smothered once again. He REALLY needed to get used to this.
15511111.title: Dinner Time

155121.content:
Your name is Aito Tsukimi; a college student. You had short black hair, red irises, and fair skin. You wore a white shirt and blue jeans along with a pair of red glasses and black sneakers. You were already a senior and on the verge of graduating number one in your class and today was a leisure day for you. However, it wasn't one you were spending alone...even though it felt like it.

It all began a few months ago when an Interspecies Exchange officer came to your door with an offer you couldn't refuse. She said that you'd been selected as the host family for a Monoeye named Manako. Apparently, she'd become fascinated with the human world and was able to take a leave of absence from her work in Monster Ops: Neutralization, or M.O.N. for short, to attend the Inetrspecies Exchange as a representative of her people. You'd long since been fascinated with monsters, so of course you accepted; even though the woman who gave you her threatened to jail you if you harmed her.

However, you were walking in a park with her only...she was very far behind. Manako had short purple hair and one eye in the center of her forehead with a blue iris. She wore a blue sunhat with a pink rose in it, a light blue sweater, a white blouse, a knee-length blue skirt and white shoes. She was supposed to remain with you at all times, but she was too nervous to even come within a few feet of you.

"Um...Manako?" you asked hesitantly, which made Manako freak out and fall down in shock. You hurriedly ran to her side and held her in you arms. "Are you okay?"

Manako opened her eye and blushed profusely when she noticed you staring. At first, she thought that you were freaked out by her eye, but she noticed that you weren't. She then blushed even more to the point that steam was coming out of her ears. Unfortunately, this made her remind herself of something she'd neglected to take care of before they went out.

"Um...Aito?" Manako asked nervously. "What is it?" you asked.

"I...I..."
