"Well, you're definitely becoming quite the detective, aren't you? .....Anyway: Yes, all five of these locations have been heavily renovated to accommodate both Humans and Monsters. The most recent of these places to receive the renovations was the Arcade Center in Akihabara. But the question still remains on what their motivations were for attacking these public areas with explosives." Adam replied, contemplating on what the Sons of Susanoo's motives were behind the bombings, seeing this as more than just a mere coincidence or simply another act of hateful violence against monsters. Of course, you theorized that their motives were.......
15533222111211121121111.title: A Brother At Work

choices: From there, Adam asked what you thought about Alma
Then, you both heard Mom call out for dinner.
155332221112111211211111.content:
".....Judging from these locations being targeted by the Sons of Susanoo, I believe these assholes are trying to send a message." You explained, your mind beginning to connect the dots on the motive behind these terrorist attacks. In response, Adam spoke back to you and asked, "Yeah, we know that, bro. But....what kind of message are we talking about here?"

"That humans and monsters can never peacefully co-exist. Think about it, Adam: all four of these places are known to have a concentrated amount of both humans and monsters mingling and interacting with one another. This shows that there CAN be a peaceful co-existence between humanity and the monsters, something that a group like the Sons of Susanoo would absolutely despise with a burning passion." You answered, giving your older brother a theorized guess on what the Sons of Susanoo's motives were behind these inexcusable acts of terrorism.

"In other words, they're simply committing these acts of violence out of pure malice." Adam remarked, seeing how obvious the motives were when it came to the Sons of Susanoo. However, you then turned your head a little to look at your older brother, arms still crossed, as you then spoke to Adam and said, "Malice, spite, hatred, stigma. No matter what people call it, it's still prejudice, Adam. I believe the Sons of Susanoo are attempting to create a schism in society between humans and monsters with all these bombings, build up some tension and paranoia as a whole."

"Jeez, since when did you get all philosophic on me, Eli? It's as if you're taking this threat seriously." Adam replied, noticing how philosophical you sounded just moments ago. Of course, you were taking this situation seriously, as you then spoke toward Adam, your voice sporting a serious no-nonsense tone, and answered, "I am, brother. After all, the Sons of Susanoo won't stop these bombing attacks until their demands are met: A war between humans and monsters. Like it or not, Adam, we've gotta stop them before they escalate into assassinating people."

"Like who?" Adam asked, raising an eyebrow at you in both curiosity and a sense of uneasiness. From there, you then typed on one of the two keyboards, bringing up some digital newspaper articles about a convention where both humans and monsters are welcome to attend called "Mon-Con", as you then highlighted a section of the article where Adam looked at it and said, "Wait a sec, is that?" "-Mon-Con? Exactly. According to the information on here, Mon-Con is a big convention that promotes and celebrates the friendship between monsters and humans, a prime target for the Sons of Susanoo to engage. However, from what I heard, there are rumors speculating that there's been a recent development regarding the Interspecies Exchange Program, one that allows interspecies marriage between a human and a monster." You explained, revealing some startling new information to your older brother in the process.

Surprised to hear such a revelation, Adam's eyes opened wide in both shock and realization, as he then spoke to you and said, "Interspecies Marriage?! Wait a minute: If the Sons of Susanoo get word of such an announcement-" "They'll start assassinating the representatives of the Interspecies Exchange Program? That's exactly how they will respond, Adam, which is why we need to stop them before their plan bears any fruition." You answered, confirming your brother's worries and concerns in the process.

In response to such news, Adam slumped back in the chair a little, where he then looked at you and asked, ".....This is going to be one of those long cases, isn't it?" "Afraid so, brother. After all, Mon-Con doesn't start until 2 weeks from now, meaning we have an ample amount of time to figure what exactly the Sons of Susanoo are planning, stop them from carrying out their mission, and save countless lives in the process. Besides, we've handled tougher cases before, why should this be any different." You replied, reassuring Adam that the two of you can do this. Of course, this helped ease your brother's mind some, as the two of you then bumped fists in agreement.
155332221112111211211111.title: Sending A Message

choices: Your sister, Julie, who was currently in a custom costume.
Your younger brother, Connor, who wanted to see you.
Actually, it was someone else instead.....
1553322211121112112111111.content:
In an attempt to divert the subject of the conversation, Adam then looked at you and said, "And speaking of monsters, what do you think of that Arachne girl?" To be honest, you were caught a little off-guard by your brother's approach on the subject regarding Alma, causing you to blush a bit in the process. After all, you've only just met Alma nearly an hour ago. So, in response, you scratched the back of your head somewhat, as you then spoke up and replied, "Well, I.... I, uh....."

"Oh come on, Eli! You like her, don't you?" Adam remarked, tugging on your strings a little, just to get a response from you, which was obviously working somewhat. However, you couldn't help but admit to yourself that you're beginning to have some affectionate feelings toward Alma, as you then let out a sigh and replied, "....Look, you're right: I do have some feelings toward Alma. I'm just not sure if she feels the same about me though."

Upon hearing those words from you, Adam then stood up from the chair, turned around to face you, as he then put his right hand on your left shoulder and answered, "Eli, I saw her blushing when the two of you entered the hotel lobby. That alone can tell if a person has feelings for you or not. So here's some advice for you: Spend some time with her. You know, get to know her better."

Feeling reassured by your elder brother, you then bumped fists with him once more, as you spoke to Adam and said, "Thanks for the advice, Adam." "Anytime, brother. Just be careful on what you say to her." Adam answered, wrapping his arms around you in a brotherly embrace for a short moment or two before letting you go. From there, Adam returned to sitting in front of the monitors and keyboards, cracking his knuckles, ready to get to work and said, "In the meantime, I'll use the Ice-Computer to scan for any locations the Sons of Susanoo would use as safehouses. With luck, we should be able to get some useful data."

However, as you were about to exit the workshop, you turned back to look at your brother, raising an eyebrow at the odd name he gave to the Batcomputer ripoff stored in your father's workshop. "Ice-Computer? Really?! Was that the best name you could come up with for our ripoff of the Batcomputer?" You asked, questioning why Adam would give it such a horrible name in the first place. But as you facepalmed yourself, Adam looked back at you and replied, "Don't like the name? Okay, "Ice-Man": you got a better name than what I got?"

Of course, Adam had to call you by that unoriginal name the press has dubbed you, since there was already an Ice-Man in the X-Men comics and movies. So, in friendly retaliation, you fired back at your older brother and remarked, "How does "The Frost Engine" sound to you?" After thinking about it for a moment or two, Adam then spoke back and answered, ".....Frost Engine it is."

With that out of the way, Adam returned to the newly titled Frost Engine, typing away on the two keyboards, searching the city via hacking into Tokyo's numerous CCTV cameras. On the other hand, you left the workshop to allow him to continue his handiwork, closing the door behind you on the way out. However, it was there you then ran into....
1553322211121112112111111.title: Thoughts About Alma

choices: However, you decide to follow Julie, just to see if Alma's alright back there.
You decided to check on Alma later. Right now, you've got some work to do.
Actually, you decided to do something else instead.....
15533222111211121121111111.content:
Normally, you would usually bump into your father or your younger brother Connor. Instead of those two however, you accidentally ran into your slightly younger sister, Julie Prentiss. Out of all the siblings in your family, Julie had undergone the most amount of changes since she got here to Japan. One of those lifestyle changes included your sister devoting herself to a hobby she's become quite fond of: Cosplay.

Of course, you have heard of cosplay before from a few people you knew. From what you've gathered, it was where various people, both male and female, create their own highly detailed costumes and dress up as their favorite character, whether said character came from an anime, manga, movie, TV show, or any other form of media. Although you didn't mind your sister's hobby, you knew for a fact that Julie got into this sort of thing from her 4 newfound friends, Ayame Tatsuno, Shizune Akagami, Ryuko Ginoza, and Kasumi Sotoya. They basically attend the same school as Julie, known as Tsunemori Academy. Also, from what you've overheard, Julie and her 4 friends were part of a school club they've created, aptly called "The Cosplay Club", due to all of it's members being avid cosplayers, attending various conventions to show off their handiwork, which has gained them quite the cult following in convention circles.

Anyway, shortly after you unintentionally bumped into her, Julie dropped what appeared to be rolls of colored fabric onto the floor, causing to yell at you a little as she exclaimed, "Eli!! Watch where you're going!" "Sorry! Didn't see you there, sis." You apologized, as Julie then bent down to pick up the rolls of fabric dropped on the floor. However, as Julie grabbed each roll of fabric, you managed to get a good long look at what she was currently wearing.

In appearance, her hair was now a set of long bright pink hair, which was currently styled into a pair of curly twin tails. Your guess was that she was wearing some sort of special wig, covering up her brown hair in the process. Her skin appeared to be painted a pasty white, while she wore a pair of specialized contact lenses that made the white sclera of her eyes black and her irises a bright red hue, along with sporting blood red lips and red nails. Her clothes were also different as well, which seemed to be close to punk and gothic fashion, as she wore a lowcut red corset with frilled black trim, and paired with a black ruffled miniskirt with a white belt. Not to mention, she also wore a set of red flower earrings.

Around her neck, Julie was wearing a black leather spiked choker, while she wore a set of black, shoulder-length fingerless gloves with white spike bands. And finally, she currently wore a set of black thigh-high stockings underneath a pair of white zip-up high heel boots. If you had to guess, she looked like some sort of sexy female vampire. "Uh, Julie? You do realize that it's not exactly Halloween yet, right?" You sarcastically remarked, obviously letting her know that you're aware of what she's wearing.

"I know that! I'm just making sure that everything's set for Mon-Con." She answered, just as you got a glimpse of the artificial fangs she implanted on her upper canines. After all, your sister seemed quite excited to go to Mon-Con, since she and the Cosplay Club are allowed to attend the convention as a way to promote their school club. However, it was then she noticed you looking at her as you asked, "....So, what are you supposed to be? A sexy female vampire?"

"What? No! I'm cosplaying as Megumi Shimizu from Shiki!" Julie exclaimed, feeling a little insulted by your lack of knowledge of the character she was cosplaying as, fuming a little in the process. In response, you then spoke to her and said, "Okay, okay, I'm sorry! But still, what's with the fabric, anyway? Did Mom put you up to this?" "Obviously, yeah. Apparently, she wants to make a costume for your Arachne friend over there." Julie explained, just fully aware of Alma's presence, as she carried the rolls of fabric in her arms, walking toward the nearby room where your mother designs fashionable clothes and costumes.
15533222111211121121111111.title: Your Sister The Cosplayer

choices: From you decided to get to work on finding Yuichi Gasai.
Suddenly, your younger brother, Connor, tackled you with a hug.
155332221112111211211111111.content:
However, being aware of Alma's anxiety as well as your sister walking around the house dressed up as Megumi from Shiki, you decided to follow your female sibling toward your mother's Sewing Room, just to see if Alma was doing alright without you. After all, you could easily tell that she wasn't exactly the type to strip down in front of people she just met, where you then heard Alma's voice from inside the Sewing Room, as she hesitantly asked, "Um....A-Are you sure th-that this is necessary, Mrs. Prentiss?"

"I'm positive, Alma. After all, we need your exact measurements in order to make sure the costume fits you comfortably. And please, call me Josephine." Your mother replied, reassuring the timid Arachne that what she was doing was necessary in making Alma's costume. From there, as Julie entered the room with the rolls of fabric in her arms, you noticed how Alma became a little unnerved upon seeing Julie in full cosplay attire, since your sister did look exactly like Megumi Shimizu from Shiki, right down to the pasty white skin and artificial fangs in her teeth.

Shortly after placing the rolls of fabric upon a nearby table, Julie turned around and noticed how unnerved Alma was. So in an attempt to calm her down, Julie carefully approached Alma and said, "Hey, take it easy. It's just a costume." From there, Julie carefully removed the colored contact lens from her right eye, showing her light brown human eyes toward the female Arachne and said, "See? It's just makeup. Even my fangs aren't real, they're just for show."

Fortunately, upon seeing what was shown before her, Alma slowly but surely calmed down, just as Julie re-inserted in colored contact lens into her right eye once more. Obviously confused on what she had just witnessed, Alma then spoke up while your mother began to wrap the measuring tape around Alma's spider abdomen and asked, "But....I-I don't understand.....W-Why would you dress up like that?" "My daughter loves to dress up as characters from Japanese cartoons. She joined her school's costume club and has been like this ever since." Your mother answered, explaining to Alma why Julie was dressed up like she is now in the first place.

"It's called Cosplay, Mom! And it's anime, not Japanese cartoon! There's a difference." Julie explained, correcting her mother in the process. "Sorry, sweetie! You know I'm not exactly into what you kids watch these days." Your mother apologized, seeing as how she wasn't as devoted as Julie when it came to watching anime, just as he had finished measuring Alma's physique......well, most of it.

"Now then, let's see if we can measure your breast size, dear." Your mother said to Alma, which caused the timid Arachne to wrap her arms around her bra-covered breasts in both defense and embarrassment, as her cheeks blushed a deep crimson hue all over. Of course, Julie attempted to reassure Alma and said, "It's alright, we're simply just going to take your measurements, nothing more."

Eventually, Alma slowly lowered her guard, lowering her arms to her sides in the process. From there, your mother then proceeded to wrap the measuring tape around Alma's breasts, causing the Arachne to blush even more than earlier. "Oooh, you're an F-Cup! My, for an Arachne, you're excellently well-endowed, dearie." Your mother excitedly said, complimenting Alma's developed bust, making the shy Arachne blush even more, unsure if she should be embarrassed or relieved.

Of course, you've stayed hidden the whole time during their conversation. However, it was there that you then heard Julie spoke toward Alma and asked, "So, Alma......what do you think of my brother Eli?" In turn, this took Alma by surprise, as she put her clothes back on and said, "W-Why would you say something like that?" "Oh it's alright, honey. Julie's a little curious is all. So tell us: What do you think of my son?" Your mother replied, becoming involved with such a question as well.

At first, Alma obviously didn't want to answer such a sensitive topic. However, she eventually opened up about the subject, while you keenly listened in on the conversation, where Alma then spoke up and hesitantly answered, ".....He's, um...... H-He's very nice, caring, and um......" "It's okay, I think we get kinda get it, Alma." Julie said, telling Alma that she doesn't need to say much more, judging from the look of how red the Arachne's cheeks were for that moment
155332221112111211211111111.title: Dressing Up An Arachne

choices: The next morning, you woke up with Alma laying next to you.
A few days later, you continued your investigation as Frost.
Actually, let's skip to about a week later, shall we?
1553322211121112112111111111.content:
Although you couldn't help but blush yourself upon hearing that Alma has potential feelings for you, you were quickly reminded of what you clearly had to do, as a news report appeared on the TV, which confirmed another bombing attack, this time at a local fitness center in downtown Shinjuku. "The Sons of Susanoo aren't stopping one bit with these terror attacks. I think it's time I start my search for Yuichi Gasai. Maybe he can she's some light on his "friends" are truly planning." You thought to yourself, your face displaying this stern serious look.

=======================

5 hours later, night had begun to fall upon the city of Tokyo, as you quickly traversed across the numerous rooftops using a combination of parkour and your ice powers. Currently, you were dressed in your vigilante attire, which featured some sleek grey and blue sneakers, grey cargo pants, a pale blue t-shirt with a white snowflake insignia on the front with a lightweight kevlar best underneath to protect yourself from small firearms like pistols, shotguns, and submachine guns (SMGs), along with a grey aviator jacket and black fingerless gloves. Of course, you also had your neckwarmer as well, which covered up the lower half of your face all while wearing a set of winter goggles to disguise yourself better from identification. Underneath your neckwarmer, you had Adam's voice modulator strapped around your neck, with the voice modulator currently touching your adam's apple in the process.

After traversing from rooftop to rooftop, you stopped on a rooftop overlooking a bar/strip club, as you then knelt down on one knee to examine the streets below. From there, you then heard your older brother's voice via wireless Bluetooth earpiece on your right ear, where you then heard him speak and asked, "Frost, have you reached the vantage point?" Of course, just to prevent being compromised, you both decided to use aliases during your vigilante patrols. Adam went with alias "Eagle Eye", while you went with the most obvious choice for an alias, "Frost".

However, due to your multiple patrols, your reputation as the vigilante Frost, has grown considerably, becoming more than just rumors that people gossip about throughout Tokyo, but the local news station, TNS (Tokyo News Station), have begun a "Frost Forecast", as a way of spreading the news of your exploits as Frost. Anyway, in response, you spoke into the earpiece and spoke to Adam, the voice modulator masking your actual voice, causing you to have a deeper voice when speaking, and answered, "Affirmative, Eagle Eye. Judging from your extensive research on him, I'm guessing Gasai frequently visits this establishment."

"Correct, Frost. According to the CCTV cameras within the area, Yuichi Gasai frequently visits this specific bar strip club combo every day for the past 2 to 3 weeks. Of course, we're not sure of what his reasons are for visiting this place in a regular basis, but that's for you to find the answer." Adam explained, only speculating as to why Yuichi Gasai would regularly visit this certain place for the past several weeks.

"And speaking of that bastard....." You said, just as you quickly noticed him exiting the bar/strip club, straightening his jacket in the process. From there he turned left and started walking down the sidewalk, as you then stood up and said, "He's heading down Tsubaki Avenue. I'm going to cut him off and have a "nice" chat with him." "Just remember, Frost: We need him alive and conscious if we're going to get any information out him." Adam answered, reminding you of what was required to interrogate him.

"Noted. Frost out." You replied, as you then used your ice powers to launch yourself onto another rooftop across the street, where you then landed in a nearby alleyway, ready to intercept the Sons of Susanoo member. From there, as he was clearly in your view, you quickly yanked Gasai into the dark alleyway, where he landed stomach first onto the pavement. "What the hell?!" He said, just as you then pinned him down with your ice powers, since he landed in a large man-sized puddle, which was rendered frozen by your ice powers, encasing his legs and arms in the icy trap, as he laid there in a crawling position.

From there, as you put your foot on his back, you looked down at him and said, "Hello, Yuichi Gasai. Remember me?" Obviously, he didn't recognize you at first due to the voice modulator altering your voice, but he easily recognized the same situation he was in from earlier, as he turned his head and noticed you as he yelped, "Oh no, it's you! You.....Y-You're Frost!" "Aww, you remember me. I'm touched!" You replied, where you then gave him a swift kick to the abdomen, as he then spoke out of fear and asked, "W-What do you want?!"

Then, you grabbed Gasai by the back of his head and answered, ".....What I WANT!!, Yuichi, is information. I know what you and those overzealous fanatics are doing, and I don't like it one tiny bit. I know of the bombings in Shinjuku, Ginza, Shibuya, and Akihabara. And I know that your fellow Sons of Susanoo are directly responsible for these acts of terrorism. So if you want to live with all of your limbs still attached, then tell me what your comrades are planning!"

At first, Yuichi didn't talk, he tried to block out the numbing pain but to no avail, as you then made the ice creep further up his legs, causing his body temperature to be lowered by 7 degrees fahrenheit, making him shiver in the process. Eventually, he yelped, ".....Okay, O-Okay, I-I'll t-talk!!" "Then start talking!" You demanded, squeezing the information out of Yuichi Gasai, as he then spoke up and confessed, "The Sons of Susanoo are trying to stir up tensions between humans and monsters. T-They'll kill anyone who sympathizes with those damn freaks! B-But our leader, Kenji Takamoto, wants to attack a convention that's c-coming up in the next two w-weeks!" "You're too kind." You sarcastically remarked, as you then quickly knocked him unconscious, now knowing that the Sons of Susanoo's next target was confirmed to be Mon-Con.

"Did you get anything out of him?" Adam asked, just as you then responded and answered, "I did. Turns out they are going to attack Mon-Con after all. Give an anonymous call to the TMPD. Let them know I got Yuichi Gasai in the alleyway in Tsubaki Avenue." Of course, when you meant by TMPD, you were referring to the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, as you then quickly traversed back up onto the rooftops while Adam spoke to you and replied, "Understood, Frost. Police cruisers are on their way now."

Knowing that your hunch was right, you now knew that the Sons of Susanoo were definitely gunning for the Mon-Con convention in the next two weeks, which meant you had to find out how their plan will play out once they commence the attack.
1553322211121112112111111111.title: The Hunt For Yuichi Gasai

choices: Eating breakfast with your family and Alma, who sat next to you.
Examine the bomb schematics with Adam, understanding how they work.
Actually, you were doing something else instead.....
15533222111211121121111111113.content:
There are a many people who would say that a lot can happen within a single week, and the long week you had to endure was definitely no exception. Having to alternate between the life with your family and the life of the vigilante Frost, you pretty much had your hands full. However, over the course of 7 days, you noticed a slight change in Alma: she seemed to be slowly gaining some self-confidence over the course of a single week.

Though as for how confident she was, well......she seemed to have become more social with your family, including your 3 siblings, your mother and father, and even your family's butler Adrian. However, the female Arachne still showed signs of being timid from time to time. You figured that maybe the reason why Alma was gaining some self-confidence was because of the time she spent with you and your family, almost as if she had a bit of an anxiety disorder.

Of course, she was occasionally confused when your sister Julie would change up her cosplay outfit and appearance, almost looking like a completely different person. After all, you remembered when 6 days ago, Alma expected Julie to walk out dressed up as Megumi Shimizu from Shiki, but instead, Julie came out dressed up as Suiseiseki from Rozen Maiden. Fortunately, unlike you and your brothers, Julie wouldn't yell at Alma while bluntly telling her who she's supposed to be. Instead, Julie would allow Alma to guess who her character is, which eventually resulted in your sister calmly telling the female Arachne who she's cosplaying as. You figured that it was between two girls on why Julie wasn't yelling at Alma like she would with you, Adam, or Connor.

Meanwhile, as Frost, your investigation into the Sons of Susanoo's planned attack on Mon-Con has gained some momentum, shedding some light into what sort of attack they were going to execute upon the upcoming convention. Apparently, the Sons of Susanoo were planning on using bombs packed with a devastating cocktail mix of White Phosphorus and Napalm, which were considered as highly illegal contraband in Japan due to their destructive potential on both hostiles and civilians alike.

Unfortunately, due to your investigation into their operations, the Sons of Susanoo attempted to stay hidden for a while, having discreet meetings, covering their tracks, and destroying any further evidence regarding their planned attack on Mon-Con. However, with Mon-Con only seven days away, you knew you had to dig deeper into their operations, i.e the bomb schematics, where the bombs would be placed during the convention, and how to disarm the explosives, along with finding out how many of their operatives are already inside Mon-Con. Overall, the situation had become a bit more dire than expected.

Though, as for what you were doing right now, you were currently.......
15533222111211121121111111113.title: One Long Week

choices: The conversation continues involving the topic at hand.....
Shortly after the conversation, the elevator opens up, revealing Julie's friends
155332221112111211211111111131.content:
Although you were currently in the midst of an investigation, even you knew that from time to time you had to take a break from the vigilante career and socialize. Currently, you were eating breakfast alongside your mother, Adam, Julie, and Connor, with Alma sitting beside you, using two stools as a makeshift chair for her lower 8-legged spider half. However, your father already left for work, as you ate some Belgian waffles with pulp-free orange juice, while your sister had some cereal with milk, your mother had French Toast with a cup of tea, Connor had two Cinnamon Pop-Tarts, and Adam ate a small stack of pancakes covered in maple syrup.

Alma on the other hand, had a completely different kind of breakfast. Due to her Arachne physiology, she would be known to drink blood like a real spider would, due to the small fangs on Alma's upper canines, as she drank a cup of blood from a glass chalice, using her fangs to suck up the blood inside her mouth. However, you decided to strike up a conversation, as you looked at Julie and asked, "Julie, you said earlier that you were getting everything set for Mon-Con, right? So, why are you attending that convention, anyway?"

"....You know one of my friends at the Cosplay Club, Ayame? Well apparently, her family was chosen to be the host family of a female Lamia. I think her name was Irenka. Anyway, she was given permission to attend the same school as me, Ayame, and the others. Irenka's now the first extra-species member of the Cosplay Club, and thanks to that, we can attend Mon-Con. Currently, we plan on having her cosplay as Cassiopeia from League of Legends." Julie explained, going into detail on how she and her friends were able to participate in Mon-Con.

"That sounds nice, Julie. Perhaps you should invite your friends over someday." Your mother replied, drinking a sip of her tea in the process. From there, Julie then spoke once more and answered, "Actually, Mom. They're coming over here today. Ayame, Shizune, Ryuko, Kasumi, even Irenka." "But, why are your friends coming over here, Julie?" Alma asked, a little confused and hesitant, especially when it came to meeting new people right off the bat. Fortunately, Julie reassured Alma some and explained, "...Don't worry, Alma. Ayame and the others are really good friends of mine. After all, I've met Irenka twice now, and she seems pretty nice. Though as for why they're coming over here, well we're trying to prepare for Mon-Con, since we got ourselves VIP Access passes due to a contest we've won almost a month ago, not to mention we're trying to choose our costumes to wear during that time. So yeah, we got a lot of work to do."

Shortly after taking a sip of his coffee, Adam then spoke toward his younger sister and said, "Sounds like you've got a lot on your plate, Julie." "Speaking of stuff, have you seen the news about Frost?" Connor asked, bringing up the topic about your vigilante alias, since your younger brother was a fan of superheroes. In response, Adam decided to satisfy his little brother's question and replied, "What did you find out, Connor?" "Well, from what I've heard on the news, the police were called by someone to arrest Yuichi Gasai. When they got there, he was pinned down by ice. That man said it was Frost who did this to him." Connor answered, obviously enthusiastic about proving the existence of the vigilante known as Frost.

Being skeptical about what she heard, Julie then spoke toward Connor and said, "Alright, then why would Frost call the cops on some guy?" "Julie! It's because Yuichi Gasai was part of that terrorist group, the Sons of Susanoo! You know, the people responsible for bombing those places all over the city." Connor explained, disclosing the information at hand. From there, your mother put her two cents into the conversation as well and said, "I heard about them.... They're the people who hate extra-species like Alma, right?"

"That's right, Mom! Apparently, the Sons of Susanoo are very much against the Cultural Exchange Between Special Bill, as well as the Interspecies Exchange Program. In other words, they really really hate monsters with a passion. They went as so far as terrorism in order to make a point." Connor answered, explaining even more of the topic at hand.
155332221112111211211111111131.title: Breakfast With The Prentiss Family

choices: After breakfast, you & Adam look over the blueprints of the convention center.
While they're working on their costumes, Julie & friends started talking....
1553322211121112112111111111312.content:
However, shortly after Connor had spoken, all of you then heard a loud *ding* noise, which originated from the private elevator that led up to your family's estate. "Well speaking of my friends, that must be them." Julie said, as she stood up from the table and walked toward the elevator doors. From there, as the doors slid open simultaneously, there stood Julie's BFFs from the Cosplay Club at Tsunemori Academy: Ayame Tatsuno, Shizune Akagami, Ryuko Ginoza, and Kasumi Sotoya. Along with them, Irenka was also present as well, currently wearing a winter coat due to her cold-blooded physiology.

In appearance, Irenka had a long scaly blue snake tail, which had these white tiger stripes on the back. She had long blonde hair that was put into a braided ponytail, showing her blue pointed Lamia ears and her sky blue eyes. Aside from that, you noticed that she had a modest breast size underneath that coat of hers. Of course, in response to seeing her friends, Julie wrapped them in a big hug and said, "Girls! It's so good to see you again!"

"It's great to see ya too, Julie! So, how's it going?" Ryuko asked, where Julie then lets go of her friends and answered, "Oh, it's going good so far. Anyway, welcome to my home! Come in, I got everything set up for us." From there, your sister gestured both her four friends and Irenka to exit the elevator and enter her home. In all honesty, Julie's friends were amazed that Julie's family was able to afford this place.

But then, Shizune noticed you and your family, as she spoke toward Julie and asked, "So, I'm guessing that's your family, Julie?" "Yep, that's them, Shizune! This is my older brother, Adam." Julie explained, as she began to introduce each of your family members one by one. Of course, Adam looked at them and said, "Nice to meet you, girls." "That's my slightly older brother, Eli." Julie said, shifting to you, where you looked at Julie's friends and replied, "Hey."

"That's my Mom, Josephine Prentiss." Julie explained, now shifting over toward your mother, who waved at the four girls and one Lamia and answered, "You must be her friends. Julie told me a lot about you and your school club." From there, Julie then shifted the focus toward Connor and said, "That's my younger brother, Connor." "Hi there!" Connor replied, waving at them in greetings. Finally, Julie introduced Alma to her friends, making the timid Arachne turn around to face them and said, "And this here is our friendly neighborhood Arachne, Alma."

Obviously, Alma was very shy at first, but she eventually waved to them with a shaky hand and hesitantly replied, "...H-Hello." "Wow, seems my family's not the only one that was chosen to have an extra-species live with them." Ayame said, admitting that Alma did look cute as a shy Arachne. But then, you heard Irenka speak for the first time, as she examined Alma for a second or two and said, "Funny. I thought Arachnes were supposed to be.....sadistic." "Well, she was harassed by a gang of racist jerks until my brother Eli arrived and kicked their asses, Irenka." Julie explained to Irenka, confessing why Alma was behaving like she was now.

Fortunately, Irenka took what your sister said with a grain of salt, backing away from Alma in the process as she said, "....I suppose that you have a point there, Julie." "Now then, what do you say we get to work on our costumes for Mon-Con?" Julie asked, as her friends nodded in agreement. From there, they followed Julie into your mother's Sewing Room, with Irenka slithering not too far behind.
1553322211121112112111111111312.title: Julie's Friends

15533222111211121121111111113121.content:
Eventually after breakfast, you and Adam returned to your father's workshop, examining the municipal blueprints of the overall layout of the Tokyo International Exhibition Center. However, the locals prefer to call it by it's more popular name, "Tokyo Big Sight". According to the information that Adam managed to get access to, Tokyo Big Sight was confirmed to be the location for this year's Mon-Con.

Currently you stood there, looking down at the blueprint schematics that showed every section of the Tokyo International Exhibition Center, including the Conference Tower, the East Exhibition Hall, and the West Exhibition Hall. After all, you were looking for areas within Tokyo Big Sight that would create the most amount of casualties when those White Phosphorus-Napalm bombs are detonated. In other words, you were searching for areas where the most amount of both people and monsters would gather in a crowd, which in turn, would accumulate numerous casualties.

"So, remind me what we're looking for exactly, Eli?" Adam asked, who was currently examining the schematics of the bombs that the Sons of Susanoo were making for their attack on Mon-Con within the week. From there, you spoke toward your brother while continuing your examination of the building schematics and answered, "Figuring out a way to prevent as many casualties as possible. After all, those bombs were meant to burn and maim people, Adam. You saw those schematics yourself."

"I know, brother. It's just that....I can't help but feel like there's more going on than what we're actually facing." Adam explained, feeling as if there was some shady individuals working behind the shadows, supporting and manipulating those who want to eradicate any and all extra-species. For a moment there, you too thought of such a scenario as well, agreeing with your older brother somewhat, just as you looked back at him and replied, "....Maybe. But if there is someone behind the scenes pulling strings like some twisted puppeteer, we'll find 'em eventually."

"*sigh*....I hope you're right. For everyone's sake." Adam remarked, hoping that you were indeed right about what you said. However, it was there the two of you then noticed the door to your father's workshop was opening, revealing to be none other than....
15533222111211121121111111113121.title: Planning A Contingency

155332221112111211211111111131212.content:
"So, this is your supposed lair? I can't say I'm disappointed in my hunch, Mr. Prentiss." A voice rang out, causing both you and your older brother to look toward the voice's source, only to see an adult woman you weren't exactly familiar with. In appearance, she had a slim but voluptuous figure, sporting a pair of pale brown eyes, which were covered by a set of black sunglasses, along with displaying long straight black hair that reached just above her rear.

Judging from her choice of clothing, she appeared to be some sort of government agent, wearing a white dress shirt with a black tie, along with a black blazer jacket and matching professional skirt, complete with black pantyhose and heeled shoes. However, you couldn't help but feel like you've met this woman before, as Adam stood up and went to greet her, shaking her hand in the process as he said, "Ms. Kuroko Smith, glad you decided to come over here."

That was when it hit you like a bed of nails, you HAVE met her before! On the phone, back when you've called Adrian to pick up you and Alma a little over a week ago! This was the same woman who knew about your vigilante career as Frost: Ms. Kuroko Smith. "WHAT THE HELL, ADAM!?! Why did you invite her over here!?!" You yelled, obviously not too happy at what your brother has done.

"Calm down, Eli! I invited Ms. Smith over here to look over the evidence we've gathered from our investigation into the Sons of Susanoo. After all, this is something that the Cultural Exchange Security Squad and M.O.N should be fully aware of. So please, give her a chance." Adam explained, trying to get you to relax some, despite the fact that Ms. Smith blackmailed you a little sometime ago. Of course, you pounded your fist once onto the table surface out of frustration, then looked at your brother and Ms. Smith and answered, "....Fine! But if she starts leaking out info about me being a vigilante, I'll kick her ass. Got it?!"

"Crystal. So tell me, Adam: What have you and your *ahem* brother discovered in your investigation?" Ms. Smith asked, which prompted Adam to show her the bomb schematics, as well as the information on what the Sons of Susanoo's plans are for these anti-personnel explosives, while he spoke toward Ms. Smith and explained, "To be quite honest, Ms. Smith, it's somewhat worse than we expected. Judging from the schematics, the bombs that the Sons of Susanoo were making have a cocktail mix of White Phosphorus and Napalm. Both are highly flammable chemicals, along with being highly illegal contraband in Japan due to their destructive potential."

"In other words, these bastards want to burn and maim as many people as possible, as well as cause numerous casualties, on both humans and monsters." You bluntly replied, still looking through the municipal blueprints of the Tokyo International Exhibition Center AKA Tokyo Big Shot. Of course, you knew what M.O.N stood for: Monster Ops: Neutralization, which was a specialized unit comprised of four extraspecies girls. It was created to handle "untouchable" situations regarding to any extraspecies lawbreakers, since regular police are unable to do their jobs and arrest them due to the certain flaws within the Cultural Exchange Between Species Bill, whether it was the human law enforcement is unable to arrest extraspecies lawbreakers, or the other way around with extraspecies law enforcement unable to arrest human criminals and lawbreakers. After all, this was the very reason why you decided to become a vigilante, because vigilantes work outside the law, just like Batman, Daredevil, or even the Punisher.

However, it was there that Ms. Smith noticed this annoyed look on your face, as she looked at you and remarked, "Oh I'm sorry, am I bothering you?" "Heh! Says the woman who happens to be very irresponsible at her job." You said, revealing some information you've discovered on Ms. Smith, as you then continued and said, "Oh yeah, I know your dirty secrets, Smith. The reason why you've been so damn irresponsible and careless at your job is because you've been overworked with all your current duties, never getting a single pay raise when you take on new responsibilities by your superiors."

Of course, this somewhat easily got on Ms. Smith's nerves, as her smug of a smirk turned into a look of frustration, where she then spoke to you and asked, "And what makes you any different from me? You had your whole lifestyle handed to you on a silver platter." "Maybe. But unlike you, I worked my frozen ass off to protect the people of this city. Being a vigilante isn't about hoping you get paid for your deeds, it's about doing the right thing. I get it: You've been stressed out from your job, but that DOESN'T give you a goddamn excuse to make other peoples' lives a living hell!! So if you want MY help, I suggest you stop whining and complaining like a spoiled brat, and start acting like someone who wants to preserve the peace between humans and monsters!" You answered, saying what you had on your mind at full blast, which felt very satisfying to you personally. Of course, the reaction on Ms. Smith's face was priceless as well, for she had this look of....
155332221112111211211111111131212.title: Unexpected Company

choices: Later that night, you began your search for Kenji Takamoto.
Meanwhile, Julie & her friends were busy making their costumes.
Actually, let's skip to a few days later, shall we?
1553322211121112112111111111312121.content:
After all, the only person that was allowed to downgrade her was her own boss, Minister Yamaguchi, as both you and Ms. Smith glared at one another, both sides having this look of anger and frustration. However, in an attempt to simmer the confrontation before it reaches it's boiling point, Adam then stood up, got in front of both of you and said, "Look, we can save this pissing contest of yours later, you two! Right now, we gotta focus on stopping the Sons of Susanoo's attack on Mon-Con."

Slowly but surely, you and Ms. Smith called a temporary truce for now, refocusing on the urgent matter at hand, just as Ms. Smith spoke to you and growled, "This isn't over, you know." "Same here." You answered, as the two of you went back toward the table and Ms. Smith asked, "So, where exactly do you think they will stage their attack?"

"According to the information we've gathered, we're speculating that the Sons of Susanoo will plant the bombs somewhere within Tokyo Big Sight. More specifically, where a large group of people and extra-species are gathered in one concentrated location. From the intel we've accumulated so far about Mon-Con, we're guessing that the bombs will be placed within Tokyo Big Sight's West Exhibition Hall. Or to be more precise, the section of the hall that surrounds the central two-tiered atrium. After all, if the Sons of Susanoo do want to cause as many casualties as possible, that's where they'll strike." Adam explained, pointing toward the West Exhibition Hall on the Tokyo Big Sight blueprints.

From there, as she crossed her arms, Ms. Smith then spoke toward Adam once more and asked, "And what happens if there are survivors, or if we do disarm the bombs?" "They'll most likely send in their soldiers and lieutenants if something has gone awry in their plans. They'll be armed with automatic weapons as well, since I've discovered enough crates of the stuff to take over both Shinjuku and Shibuya in almost a single day." You answered, speaking instead of your brother.

Of course, Ms. Smith almost seemed to be annoyed by the fact that you're basically subtly saying "Whether you like it or not, you need me if you want to stop this attack". After all, since both you and Adam now realize that Julie and her friends were going to attend Mon-Con, this ordeal became personal for both of you. "Very well, keep me informed on the situation." Ms. Smith replied, where she then left your father's workshop and out of your home.

Shortly after she left, Adam looked at you with a "What the hell were you thinking?!" face, as he then spoke to you and asked, "Remind me why you antagonized her like that?" "Because someone needed to remind her that this isn't a goddamn game when peoples' lives are dangling by a thread. Like it or not, she needs us if she wants to stop their terrorist attack on Mon-Con, Adam." You answered, as you looked at your older brother with a "This is serious" look on your face.
1553322211121112112111111111312121.title: A Frustrated Smith

1553322212.content:
So, you have decided to choose either the long legs or the small arachne, hmm? Well, why not. Now then, for those who happen to be either confused or curious about these two subspecies, then allow me to elaborate on your situation:

SMALL ARACHNE
A subspecies smaller than the standard arachne, Small Arachne are easily distinguishable from the regular arachne due to their almost child-like appearance. Their legs are short, but in exchange for their small physique, they are capable of moving much faster than the average arachne, along with being good at jumping and full of energy. Instead of spinning webs like their larger brethren, Small Arachne scurry around on the ground in search of prey. Although they can produce thread, Small Arachne only use this reserve of webbing to either stop or slow down their descent when falling from high places to prevent any injuries.

LONG LEG ARACHNE
Sometimes called "Long Legs", these large subspecies of arachne are recognized by having thinner and longer legs than the standard arachne, hence the name. Aside from having a mild-mannered personality, this arachne subspecies cannot produce thread, but they can move surprisingly quickly to secure their prey. A Long Leg Arachne's hunting instincts are so powerful that they will sometimes abandon the prey they have captured to pursue new prey. As they are especially uncompromising regarding the extermination of household pests, Long Leg Arachne are respectfully known among those troubled by such pests as "sergeants".

Well, now that you know more about these two arachne subspecies, which one will you choose? The Long Leg Arachne, or the Small Arachne?
1553322212.title: Long Legs / Small

15533222122.content: So, you've chosen the Small Arachne (see previous chapter for description). Now then, is it normal or do you want powers?
15533222122.title: Small Arachne

choices: You run into a Small Arachne getting beaten up by racists
You come home and see a woman in a black business suit
155332221221.content:
Your name is Hiro Archer. You are 18 years old and about to graduate high school. You had short white hair with streaks of black, golden eyes, and you were exceptionally pale; something that's normal when you're goth. You wore a black shirt with a skull design, a black choker, blood red pants, and silver boots. Your parents were still around the house, peppy as ever for high school sweethearts. No matter how many times they told you, you could never gasp the concept of love, even if your parents had no shame expressing it. You thought that you'd never be like them and you didn't want to be.

Still, that didn't mean that you didn't have an interest in girls. Whenever you tried to talk to them however, they always turned you down because you were..."scary". You hardly ever smiled and people were intimidated by you. Fortunately, you discovered that you weren't as scary after the day that monsters were made public. Knowing that your world existed with exotic and frightening creatures, made you feel better about yourself. Still, you couldn't guess what was coming next.

On your way home from school one day...

1553322212211.content:
As you walked down the street with your house in view, you saw a group of adults beating on someone. You thought that it was just some crook, but you saw eight bright pink arachnid-like legs that were rather small. It didn't take you long to know what was going on; a monster girl was being attacked. You always hated bullies, especially ones that attacked girls. Even though you were goth, this was something that you couldn't let them get away with. You then charged the crowd and assumed a fighting stance.

"Hey, leave that girl alone!" you yelled angrily.

"Buzz off goth! This is between us and the eight-legged freak!" one of them cried.

"She's trying to eat our kids!"

"She claims she has a host family, but she doesn't have the documents!"

"We're going to break every one of her legs!"

With that, all bets were off. You delivered a brutal take-down of the adults, unaware of the girl staring at you in awe. By the time the brawl ended, you noticed some papers in the back of the first adult's pants. You took them out and gasped in shock when you saw your family as her host family before you grabbed the man by his collar.

"These are her documents. You stole them so you'd be able to beat her." you said venomously.

"So what?! She doesn't belong here! She should've stayed with her monster family!"

With that, you brutally punched him repeatedly in the face until he slipped into unconsciousness. You then turned around and tried to help the girl up. You then saw that she had bright pink hair, four sea foam green eyes, and fair skin. She wasn't really developed since she looked like a small child, but you noticed that she was blushing heavily.

"Are you okay?" you asked. "My name is Hiro Archer."

She only stared in awe before she responded. "I need some help. My name is Lorna."

What now?

15533222122111.content:
"Well, you do know that I'm the same Hiro from your documents, right?" you asked, which made Lorna blush from excitement.

"You're a member of my host family?!" Lorna happily cried out as she lovingly embraced you. "Oh, thank you! Thank you! Thank you! I couldn't defend myself against regular humans! It was so kind of you to intervene!

You chuckled awkwardly from her embrace, but you relented when you saw her adorable sea foam green eyes. It was that you noticed other features about her. She wore a red shirt on her human half while her spider-half matched her pink legs. She had clawed hands and forearms with red opera gloves which exposed her pink fingertips. Her pink hair was also relatively short, not even reaching her shoulders, but with a red barrette in the left side of her hair. Although, she had gotten a few cuts and bruises on parts of her body, but nothing that would warrant a hospital visit.

"So, we should get you home. My dad's a doctor, so he'll be able to fix you." you suggested as you gave her paperwork back, which she immediately stuffed into her novelty cheeseburger backpack that you hadn't noticed until now.

"Thanks. That's a good idea." Lorna said as the two of you walked back to your house.

Along the way, you had been subjected to some stares from the local neighborhood people; the less racist ones. While they knew about the existence of monsters, they hadn't ever seen a Small Arachne like Lorna before, if you remembered the guidebook you'd read for a class assignment correctly. Still, your graduation was only a few weeks away and you were looking forward to it. You both soon reached your ordinary 2-story home as you unlocked the mahogany brown door. While the interior was typical, Lorna seemed to be in awe when she first saw it.

"Wow! This is such a cool home!" Lorna said in amazement.

"It's nothing special. Still, I'll go get my dad." you said as you ventured past the kitchen and went upstairs to your parent's room. When you arrived there...

15533222221.title: #8 - Zombie

155332222211.content:
Ah, Zombies.... One of the two most iconic and unique movie monsters alongside legends like Dracula, Frankenstein, The Wolfman, The Mummy, and The Creature From The Black Lagoon. Originally known to be voodoo slaves in Haiti, George A. Romero changed changed the outlook on Zombies with the movie, "Night of The Living Dead". However, these aren't the Zombies from Robert Kirkman's The Walking Dead, and here's why:

ZOMBIE
Known amongst the populace as living corpses or the living dead, Zombies are a non-human species that were formerly humans, brought back from the dead, becoming one of the walking dead due to the work of a special infectious disease. Although they can still move, they are still corpses, which means that any sustained injuries and wounds will not heal like a living body would. Aside from that, a Zombie's body will decay unless appropriate measures are taken to counteract this. Fortunately, with the recent establishment of preservation technology, they are able to live much like humans, courtesy of an antiseptic fluid that serves as a blood substitute.

EARLY ZOMBIE
Zombies created before the eventual establishment of preservation technology. To prevent any further decay, these types of Zombies spend most of their time in cold refrigerated rooms, and are only able to go outside during the freezing winter periods. However, because of their incomplete preservation, the brains of Early Zombies are....not entirely intact. In turn, this makes them very easygoing, coupled with the energy levels of a person who had just woken up.
155332222211.title: Zombie / Early Zombie

1553322222111.content: Okay, you decide to go with the modern-day Zombie. The question is, will this be normal or with powers?

155332222212.content:
From the glitz and glamour of Hollywood to the jungles of Haiti, we have the Zombies. But within the famed deserts of the Sahara and the humid bamboo-covered forests of China, we the Mummy and the Jiang Shi. For those who don't know jack about either one of these two members of the Undead, then listen and read the following information:

JIANG SHI
Sometimes known as the "Chinese Hopping Vampire", the Jiang Shi are a Zombie subspecies found primarily in Asian countries such as China, Vietnam, and Taiwan. Unlike the standard zombie, Jiang Shi are severely affected by the symptoms of a debilitating condition known as rigor mortis. In turn, this causes their joints, especially in their elbows and knees, to become particularly stiff. Due to this unfortunate side effect, Jiang Shi must practice Tai Chi every morning to stretch , allowing their limbs to bend and flex like normal human joints. However, their joints always stiffen to some degree while they sleep, forcing the Jiang Shi to hop around with their elbows and knees locked up in a straight position when they wake up.

MUMMY
Named after the preserved remains of Pharaohs from Ancient Egypt, Mummies are a zombie subspecies from dry desert areas such as Egypt or any other country with desert within a nation's borders. Miraculously, their arid environment keeps a Mummy from decaying like their undead relatives. And even without preservative technology, their bodies still remain intact. But as a side effect, their arid environment has also robbed a Mummy's skin of it's moisture, requiring them to take long baths to replenish their fluids. Alternatively, they supplement this by sucking the life force out of young men to preserve their beauty, but this functions only as a placebo. However, since many of these Mummies were ancient royalty or even nobility in life, expect them to come with.....difficult personalities.
155332222212.title: Jiang Shi / Mummy

OGRE
Sometimes known as Oni in Japan, Ogres are a non-human species possessing a durable physique and great strength. In appearance, Ogres have brown skin, one or two horns protruding from their forehead, and have pointed ears. They stand over two meters tall in height, and many are close to even three meters, making them physically larger than humans. Despite their sheer size, many Ogres are known to have laid-back and carefree personalities.

GIGANTES
The largest of their kind, Gigantes are a massive ogre subspecies, reaching heights greater than ten meters tall in height, showing how truly giant they are. Because of their massive size, a Gigantes can easily injure a group of humans with their massive bodies if they are not too careful. When they have nothing to do, Gigantes spend their time quietly holding still. As an unfortunate result, fashion is hardly a concern for a Gigantes, since there are practically no clothes large enough for these titanic beauties to wear, so they dress themselves in whatever rags they can use to preserve some sense of public order and decency. Doppelgangers and Dragonnewts, hmm? Well, those are two words I've never expected to be in the same chapter. Anyway, for those who don't have a clue about these two breeds of monster girls, then allow me to elaborate:

DOPPELGANGER
Also known as "the shadow people", Doppelgangers are a non-human species that can take on any appearance using their phantasmagoric hair. Basically, they are actually shapeshifters, and are unrelated to the paranormal phenomenon and harbingers of death known as doppelgangers. They do not wear clothes and instead spend most of their time naked, but as their appearance is not their true form, their nudity causes them no shame. Oddly enough, these mysterious creatures share much in common with the mythological "Faceless God", and little is known regarding their true nature.

DRAGONNEWT
Also known as dragonmaids, Dragonnewts are a dragon-like non-human species. Like Lamias, they are similar to other reptile species. Dragonnewts boast about their lineage, being incredibly proud of their relation to dragons, the pinnacle of all living things. But in reality though, they are simply no more than winged lizards, since their wings are much too small for legitimate flight. According to their physiological anatomy, there is a backwards-facing scale located somewhere on their body, which happens to be their weakness. However, if one were to strike at that scale, it would cause the Dragonnewt to be paralyzed from the blow.
15533222222211.title: Doppelganger / Dragonnewt

Okay, so it's either the Ryu-jin or the Wyvern. If you need descriptions, here they are.

Ryu-jin

Like dragonewts, ryu-jin are a dragon-like species, but they resemble Eastern dragons. They have deer-like horns on their heads and long tails, but unlike dragonnewts, they have no wings, making them appear to be lizardmen at first glance. They live much longer than humans, up to ten times a normal human lifespan. Like dragonewts, their backwards-facing scale is also their weakness.

Wyvern

Unlike dragonewts, their arms and wings are joined, meaning their wings are large enough to fly. They are very good fliers. They are much more wild than the rational dragonewt and ryu-jin and are extremely aggressive. However, perhaps because they resemble harpies, they are not particularly intelligent and are easily deceived.

So, what'll it be?

155332222222211.content:
Well now, this is an odd mix of monsters to put together in the same chapter; A Dullahan and a Dryad, hmm? Well, this could get interesting. However, for those who are unaware of these two unique entities, then stay awhile and listen:

DULLAHAN
Being somewhat related to the mythical Headless Horseman from the tale of Ichabod Crane & Sleepy Hollow, the Dullahan are an extremely rare non-human species with a separate head and body. However, unlike Zombies and their subspecies, Dullahans are not one of the undead, but rather a living creature. While the head and body are connected, the head actually controls the body. But when they are separated, a Dullahan's body acts independently, making them one of the more....mysterious non-human species. They call themselves gods of death and dress as such, but as this cannot be scientifically proven, the truth is simply unknown.

DRYAD
Known for their affinity toward nature, Dryads are a plantlike non-human species. Their qualities are similar to those of small to medium-sized trees or vines. Though they are easygoing and mild-mannered, Dryads tend to not associate themselves with other species (this is true of all plantlike species). However, exceptions are made for those who do not harm them or provide them with care, and they sometimes open their hearts toward helpful members of other species. The humanoid parts of a Dryad's body change according to the amount of nutrients and water they have absorbed. Regardless of their actual age, this makes it impossible to determine a Dryad's age by appearance alone. Additionally, plantlike species do not wear clothing.
155332222222211.title: Dullahan / Dryad

155332222222212.content:
An Alraune and a Mandragora, hmm? Well, to each his own, as one would say. However, if you intend on being a host family to one of these mythical equivalents to Poison Ivy, then allow me to hand you the information:

ALRAUNE
Like the Dryads, Alraunes are a plantlike non-human species, but with flowerlike qualities. Like the other plantlike species, Alraunes are pretty timid. But as they use cross-pollination rather than self-pollination to procreate, Alraunes require other species to mate (primarily humans), and they are known to be very friendly toward other species. According to the scientific reports, the humanoid sections of an Alraune's body correspond to the flowers of plants, and they resemble beautiful women in order to attract pollination partners.

MANDRAGORA
Also known as Mandrakes, Mandragoras are a plantlike non-human species with rootlike qualities. Even among the timid plantlike species, Mandragora are known for being exceptionally timid and cowardly, and they are not so much xenophobic as being extremely shy. Unlike the legends, the scream a Mandragora emits when removed from the earth isn't actually fatal. But since their scream is very loud, it does sometimes cause loss of consciousness for those standing in the vicinity.
155332222222212.title: Alraune / Mandragora

KOBOLD
Sporting some physical features similar to Man's Best Friend, a Kobold is a non-human species with dog-like qualities. They have dog ears, paw pads on their hands and feet, a functional medium-length canine tail, and short hair covering their bodies. The entire species jointly owns rich mineral deposits, where they are among the wealthiest of non-human species as a result of such riches. Like their four-legged counterparts, Kobolds are extremely friendly toward all species and use their aforementioned wealth to operate service facilities for other species in all parts of the world. Although all members of the Kobold species take daily walks in both the morning and evening, these so-called "walks" happen to be long-distance runs. After all, due to their athletic physique, it is not uncommon for a Kobold to cover over 50 kilometers (31.069 miles) in a single day.

info.brief_description: You begin a life with the women of the manga and current anime series Monster Musume
info.description:
Alright guys, this one is a bit of an odd twist on top of the anime choices I've focused on, so in this case, we have newer rules.

1. Following the Rules of the "Interspecies Exchange Bill"

A: Humans cannot harm any other species, that goes for the monsters as well, in this case of the story, accidental hits or something like in the anime is fine, but pure abuse is a HELL NO!

B: A monster girl cannot be alone without their host family. meaning they cannot go out alone, but if its a quick errand, you can leave her at your home for a moment.

C: Intercourse between human and another species is STRICTLY prohibited. However in my story, the only way around it, is if you are married to said monster girl. Now as for that, my rule is, you CANNOT start your story arc with a wife. try to build it up my friends.

2. If you do end up getting to the point of intercourse with your monster girl, you can attempt to make it realistic as you can. The best way I can actually explain this is ooooh, the "Hentai" game, Monster Girl Quest. check out the centaur girl in that one for an example.

3. Do try your best to build up a relationship here. this isn't pure erotica.

4. I do not mind what names you go with, appearances, etc. However if you do end up using powers such as I do with my Chaos options, try to use them as a LAST Resort.

5. As of now, there will be NO power that makes someone fall in love with you, control them, or ANYTHING like that. The women have free will people

6. NO RAPE

7. Please make a decent sized entry here. no 3 or 4 line entries here. I like seeing effort to make a good stories like some people aside from me create.

8. if you are going to end up basing your character on something from another anime, say DBZ, if you go Super Saiyan or something do have the power put a strain on the characters body, in other words, make it something he wouldn't use often if he didn't have something to protect.

I hope you all enjoy my work in this one. and I hope you all can make stories as well.
